original: @468b / /rgya gar skad du //
analyzed: @468b / /rgya gar skad du //
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: shr'i mam rakta ya m'a ri tantra r'a dza n'a ma /
analyzed: shr'i mam rakta ya m'a ri tantra r'a dza n'a ma /
translated: Śrī-Raktayamāri-tantra-rāja-nāma.

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dpal ldan gshin rje gshed dmar po'i rgyud kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dpal ldan gshin rje gshed dmar po'i rgyud kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba /
translated: The King of Tantras called the Glorious Red Yamāri.

original: gshin rje mthar byed dmar po la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gshin rje mthar byed dmar po la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Red Yamāri.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa bdag med ma'i bha ga la bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa bdag med ma'i bha ga la bzhugs so //
translated: the Blessed One, all the Tathāgatas merged into one, was dwelling in the bhaga of Nairātmya.

original: de la mgrin par dam 'khyud de //
analyzed: de la mgrin par dam 'khyud de //
translated: There, embracing her at the throat,

original: rang nyid sems can ched zhus pa //🔽kyee rdo rjer gsungs pa dang // thar pa de bzhin sdom par yang //
analyzed: rang nyid sems can ched zhus pa // kyee rdo rjer gsungs pa dang // thar pa de bzhin sdom par yang //
translated: he himself asked for the sake of sentient beings,🔽What was spoken in the Hevajra, and likewise in the Muktitilaka,

original: 'dus pa la sogs rgyud du yang //
analyzed: 'dus pa la sogs rgyud du yang //
translated: and in the Guhyasamāja and other tantras,

original: slar yang ches mang du gsungs kyang //
analyzed: slar yang ches mang du gsungs kyang //
translated: and again spoken in even greater abundance,

original: sems can bsam pa yongs rdzogs byed //
analyzed: sems can bsam pa yongs rdzogs byed //
translated: is for the complete fulfillment of the wishes of sentient beings.

original: da ni bdag gis rab bshad bya //
analyzed: da ni bdag gis rab bshad bya //
translated: Now I will explain it.🔽Some desire a kingdom,

original: kha cig rgyal srid 'dod pa dang // tshe ring nad med phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: kha cig rgyal srid 'dod pa dang // tshe ring nad med phun sum tshogs //
translated: long life, good health, and abundance,

original: zhi ba la sogs las rgyas pa; ;sna tshogs rgyud du gsungs pa yang //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs las rgyas pa; ;sna tshogs rgyud du gsungs pa yang //
translated: are also taught in the various tantras.🔽Whatever is not taught in the various tantras,🔽such as the performance of rites,🔽the destruction of the armies of enemies,

original: gang yang mngon par spyod pa dang // dgra yi sde nyams byed pa dang // sprod dang 'gugs dang gsod pa dang // sna tshogs rgyud du ma brjod pa'i //
analyzed: gang yang mngon par spyod pa dang // dgra yi sde nyams byed pa dang // sprod dang 'gugs dang gsod pa dang // sna tshogs rgyud du ma brjod pa'i //
translated: the killing, summoning, and attracting,

original: 'khrul 'khor 'jig rten gsum rnyed dka'//
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor 'jig rten gsum rnyed dka'//
translated: the yantras are difficult to find in the three worlds.

original: khyod la phan pa'i thabs gzung phyir //
analyzed: khyod la phan pa'i thabs gzung phyir //
translated: In order to take up the means for your benefit,

original: bshad bya lha mo gus bcas nyon //
analyzed: bshad bya lha mo gus bcas nyon //
translated: listen with respect, goddess, to what is to be explained.

original: 'khrul 'khor gang gi mthu stobs kyis //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor gang gi mthu stobs kyis //
translated: By the power of the yantras,

original: rtag tu rgyal srid thob bya ni //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyal srid thob bya ni //
translated: one should always obtain the kingdom,

original: ji srid nyi ma zla ba bzhin //
analyzed: ji srid nyi ma zla ba bzhin //
translated: as long as the sun and moon,

original: 'tsho bar 'dod do gal te min //
analyzed: 'tsho bar 'dod do gal te min //
translated: if not, one should live.

original: da ni ming gi spyod yul du //
analyzed: da ni ming gi spyod yul du //
translated: Now, in the sphere of names,🔽the arresting of semen, the summoning of armies,

original: khu ba rengs dang sde 'gugs dang // mkha' spyod nyid dang mchog tu myur //
analyzed: khu ba rengs dang sde 'gugs dang // mkha' spyod nyid dang mchog tu myur //
translated: the state of space travel, and the supreme swiftness,

original: de yi sman ni bshad par bya //🔽dang por byams pa @469a *//
analyzed: de yi sman ni bshad par bya // dang por byams pa @469a *//
translated: their medicine will be explained.

original: bsgom par bya //
analyzed: bsgom par bya //
translated: First, one should cultivate loving-kindness.

original: gnyis par snying rje de bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis par snying rje de bzhin no //
translated: Second, likewise compassion,

original: gsum par dga' ba bsgom par bya //
analyzed: gsum par dga' ba bsgom par bya //
translated: and third, one should cultivate joy.

original: bzhi pa btang snyoms rnam bsgom bya //
analyzed: bzhi pa btang snyoms rnam bsgom bya //
translated: Fourth, one should cultivate equanimity.

original: 'jig rten chos rnams brgyad po ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten chos rnams brgyad po ni //
translated: The eight worldly dharmas

original: yongs btang stong par bsam par bya //
analyzed: yongs btang stong par bsam par bya //
translated: are completely abandoned and contemplated as empty.

original: slar yang stong nyid byang chub ste //
analyzed: slar yang stong nyid byang chub ste //
translated: Again, emptiness is enlightenment.

original: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
translated: In the second, the seed is collected.

original: bzhi par yi ge dgod pa'o //🔽ra yig las byung nyi ma la //
analyzed: bzhi par yi ge dgod pa'o // ra yig las byung nyi ma la //
translated: In the fourth, the syllables are arranged.🔽From the syllable ra, there is a sun,

original: h'um byung sna tshogs rdo rje 'o //
analyzed: h'um byung sna tshogs rdo rje 'o //
translated: from hūṃ, a vajra cross.

original: de nyid kyis ni rdo rje yi //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni rdo rje yi //
translated: By that, the vajra

original: ra ba zhes dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: ra ba zhes dang de bzhin du //
translated: fence, and likewise,🔽the vajra ground and

original: sa gzhi rdo rje bcings pa 'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi rdo rje bcings pa 'o //
translated: ceiling are bound.

original: dang por stong par bsgom par bya //
analyzed: dang por stong par bsgom par bya //
translated: First, one should meditate on emptiness.

original: de nas yi ge ai dmar po yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de nas yi ge ai dmar po yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Then, from the transformation of the red syllable ai, there is a sun maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du yi ge h'um dmar po'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge h'um dmar po'o //
translated: Upon that, there is a red syllable hūṃ.

original: de'i steng du rlan dang bcas pa'i mgo bos brgyan pa'i dbyug pa'i dbus su h'um yig dmar po'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du rlan dang bcas pa'i mgo bos brgyan pa'i dbyug pa'i dbus su h'um yig dmar po'o //
translated: Upon that, in the center of a club marked with a dripping head ornament, there is a red syllable hūṃ.

original: der yang nyi ma la h'um yig go /
analyzed: der yang nyi ma la h'um yig go /
translated: Again, on the sun, there is the syllable hūṃ.

original: de las nges par byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis nam mkha'i phyogs su dpa' bo'i gzugs de la 'jig rten gsum pa thams cad bsdus nas slar yang de nyid du bcug ste /
analyzed: de las nges par byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis nam mkha'i phyogs su dpa' bo'i gzugs de la 'jig rten gsum pa thams cad bsdus nas slar yang de nyid du bcug ste /
translated: The light rays that emerge from that gather all three worlds into that form of the hero in the space above and again enter into it.

original: dpal gshin rje gshed dmar po'i gzugs su bdag nyid bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: dpal gshin rje gshed dmar po'i gzugs su bdag nyid bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine oneself in the form of glorious red Yamāri.

original: sku mdog dmar po g-yon brkyang zhing rnam par 'gyur ba'i zhal mche ba gtsigs pa /
analyzed: sku mdog dmar po g-yon brkyang zhing rnam par 'gyur ba'i zhal mche ba gtsigs pa /
translated: [He is] red, with a wrathful face, fangs bared, and right leg extended.

original: ljags 'dril ba 'jigs par byed pa /
analyzed: ljags 'dril ba 'jigs par byed pa /
translated: [He has] a curled tongue, and is terrifying.

original: klu brgyad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: klu brgyad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: [He is] adorned with the eight nāgas.

original: dbu skra dmar ser gyen du 'bar ba /
analyzed: dbu skra dmar ser gyen du 'bar ba /
translated: [His] reddish-brown hair bristles upward.

original: rked pa'i phyogs su stag gi pags pa 'dzag pas rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: rked pa'i phyogs su stag gi pags pa 'dzag pas rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: [He is] adorned with a tiger skin draped over his hips.

original: mi'u thung gsus pa 'phyang zhing 'jigs pa /
analyzed: mi'u thung gsus pa 'phyang zhing 'jigs pa /
translated: [He is] a terrifying dwarf with a pendulous belly.

original: spyan gsum @469b ba shin tu 'jigs par byed pa dmar po 'bar ba'i rgyun mi zad pa 'od zer sna tshogs kun tu 'khrugs pa /
analyzed: spyan gsum @469b ba shin tu 'jigs par byed pa dmar po 'bar ba'i rgyun mi zad pa 'od zer sna tshogs kun tu 'khrugs pa /
translated: [He has] three eyes, and his eyes are red, blazing, and unceasing, with an endless stream of terror.

original: g-yon par sred med kyi bu la sogs pa'i khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa dang / g-yas par bdud bzhi rnam par 'joms par byed pa'i dbyug pa dkar po dang klu'i rgyan la sogs pas spras pa /
analyzed: g-yon par sred med kyi bu la sogs pa'i khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa dang / g-yas par bdud bzhi rnam par 'joms par byed pa'i dbyug pa dkar po dang klu'i rgyan la sogs pas spras pa /
translated: In the right [hand] a white club which conquers the four Maras, and adorned with Naga ornaments, etc.

original: rdo rje ro langs mas phrag par 'khyud pa /
analyzed: rdo rje ro langs mas phrag par 'khyud pa /
translated: Vajrola is embracing him on the shoulder.

original: 'dod chags chen po gcig tu nges par rgyas pa dang mtshungs pa gang yin pa'i rje btsun gyi gzugs so /
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po gcig tu nges par rgyas pa dang mtshungs pa gang yin pa'i rje btsun gyi gzugs so /
translated: He is the form of the Venerable One, who is the expansion of the certainty of the one great passion.

original: rje btsun ma yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: rje btsun ma yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The Venerable Lady is also like that.

original: khyad par du mgo bo skam pos brgyan pa /
analyzed: khyad par du mgo bo skam pos brgyan pa /
translated: In particular, she is adorned with a head-ornament of dry heads.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni 'dzag pa dang bcas pa'i mgo ba'i rgyan dang ska rags kyang grol bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni 'dzag pa dang bcas pa'i mgo ba'i rgyan dang ska rags kyang grol bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The Lord has a head-ornament and a belt of dripping heads.

original: ma he dmar po la g-yon brkyang gi zhabs kyis gnas par bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: ma he dmar po la g-yon brkyang gi zhabs kyis gnas par bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He stands on a red buffalo with his left leg extended.

original: phyi nas bcom ldan 'das las skyes pa'i rtse gsum pa'i dbyug pa dkar po'i dbus su slar yang sa bon kha dog dmar po bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas bcom ldan 'das las skyes pa'i rtse gsum pa'i dbyug pa dkar po'i dbus su slar yang sa bon kha dog dmar po bsam par bya'o //
translated: Afterwards, one should think of the seed-syllable in the middle of the white three-pointed club which is born from the Lord, and which is red in color.

original: phyi nas bcom ldan 'das kyi rdo rje yang h'um yig las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nas bcom ldan 'das kyi rdo rje yang h'um yig las skyes pa'o //
translated: Then, outside, the vajra of the Lord is born from the syllable hūṃ.

original: slar yang bcom ldan 'das ma'i gsang ba'i padmar yang padma 'dab ma brgyad pa dngos su a'a:yig gis rdzogs par mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang bcom ldan 'das ma'i gsang ba'i padmar yang padma 'dab ma brgyad pa dngos su a'a:yig gis rdzogs par mtshan pa'o //
translated: Again, in the secret lotus of the Lady, the eight-petaled lotus is actually marked with the syllable aḥ.

original: de'i rjes su gsang sngags rgyal ba'i bdag nyid can ni /
analyzed: de'i rjes su gsang sngags rgyal ba'i bdag nyid can ni /
translated: After that, the Lord of the Secret Mantra,

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma konyham/
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma konyham/
translated: om sarva tathāgata anurāgaṇa vajra svabhāva ātmako ’ham.

original: lte ba'i 'og tu padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa kha dog dmar po'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i 'og tu padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa kha dog dmar po'o //
translated: Below the navel, an eight-petaled red lotus.

original: der yi ge hr'i:dmar po nges par son pa'o //
analyzed: der yi ge hr'i:dmar po nges par son pa'o //
translated: There, the red syllable hrīḥ is definitely present.

original: spyi bor son pa'i re pa dkar po slar yang bsam par bya zhing bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: spyi bor son pa'i re pa dkar po slar yang bsam par bya zhing bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The white rasanā that has gone to the crown should be imagined and inserted into the Lord’s head.

original: slar yang rdo @470a *//
analyzed: slar yang rdo @470a *//
translated: Again, the vajra path is entered.

original: rje'i lam der son par blo bzang pos bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rje'i lam der son par blo bzang pos bsam par bya'o //
translated: The wise one should imagine that.

original: phan tshun gnyis gnyis snyoms par zhugs pas ro mnyam pa'i sa bon gyi gzugs can no //
analyzed: phan tshun gnyis gnyis snyoms par zhugs pas ro mnyam pa'i sa bon gyi gzugs can no //
translated: The seed syllable, which is the nature of the union of the two, is the form of the seed syllable.

original: sa bon de lha mo bzhis rang gi gzugs su blang ba ni /
analyzed: sa bon de lha mo bzhis rang gi gzugs su blang ba ni /
translated: The four goddesses take up their own forms from that seed syllable.🔽They are located in the four directions beginning with the east, and they look at their lord and supplicate him.

original: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs bzhi rnams na gnas pa de rnams rang gi bdag po la blta zhing slong bar byed pas lha mo thams cad blang ba'i ched du glu'i mchod pa byed par blta'o //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs bzhi rnams na gnas pa de rnams rang gi bdag po la blta zhing slong bar byed pas lha mo thams cad blang ba'i ched du glu'i mchod pa byed par blta'o //
translated: One should understand that they sing a song of praise in order to take up all the goddesses.

original: thugs rje'i khro bo rje btsun nyid bzhengs shig /
analyzed: thugs rje'i khro bo rje btsun nyid bzhengs shig /
translated: “Arise, O compassionate Heruka,

original: sa gsum mtha' dag rmongs pa sol mdzod cig /
analyzed: sa gsum mtha' dag rmongs pa sol mdzod cig /
translated: remove the delusion of the entire three worlds.

original: rdo rje tsa rtsi k'as so //
analyzed: rdo rje tsa rtsi k'as so //
translated: This is by Vajra Cācī.

original: jo bo bdud bzhi po ni las rgyal ba //
analyzed: jo bo bdud bzhi po ni las rgyal ba //
translated: “O lord, you have conquered the four māras,

original: sems ni g-yengs so rje btsun nyid bzhengs shig /
analyzed: sems ni g-yengs so rje btsun nyid bzhengs shig /
translated: but your mind is distracted. Arise, O Heruka.

original: phag mos so //
analyzed: phag mos so //
translated: This is by Vārāhī.

original: 'jig rten mgron gnyer stong nyid bzhugs sam ci //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgron gnyer stong nyid bzhugs sam ci //
translated: “Are you dwelling in emptiness, the guest of the world?

original: rje btsun 'jig rten bsod nams nyid kyis bzhengs //
analyzed: rje btsun 'jig rten bsod nams nyid kyis bzhengs //
translated: Arise, O Heruka, by the world’s own merit.🔽This is by Sarasvatī.

original: dbyangs can ma yis so; ;byang chub rang bzhin 'jig rten mgron gnyer nas //
analyzed: dbyangs can ma yis so; ;byang chub rang bzhin 'jig rten mgron gnyer nas //
translated: “Having invited the world as a guest to the nature of enlightenment,

original: khyod nyid stong nyid sems shing ci la bzhugs //
analyzed: khyod nyid stong nyid sems shing ci la bzhugs //
translated: why do you dwell, thinking of emptiness?

original: goo r'is so //
analyzed: goo r'is so //
translated: This is by Gaurī.

original: rab tu sad par byas nas slar yang de la rab tu bzhugs so //
analyzed: rab tu sad par byas nas slar yang de la rab tu bzhugs so //
translated: Having fully awakened, he again abides in that.🔽Then, from the collection of semen that has transformed, he himself has the nature of the deity.

original: de'i 'og tu de la khu ba'i tshogs gyur pa las bdag nyid lha'i bdag nyid can ma he dmar po'i steng na de yang gar gyi nyams dgu dang ldan pa bandhu ka'i me tog lta bu drag po zhal gcig pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de la khu ba'i tshogs gyur pa las bdag nyid lha'i bdag nyid can ma he dmar po'i steng na de yang gar gyi nyams dgu dang ldan pa bandhu ka'i me tog lta bu drag po zhal gcig pa /
translated: On top of a red bull, he has the nine expressions of dance, is like a bandhuka flower, has one face,

original: phyag gnyis pa mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa /
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa /
translated: two arms, bared fangs,

original: dmar la zlum pa'i spyan gsum pa /
analyzed: dmar la zlum pa'i spyan gsum pa /
translated: three eyes that are red and round,

original: smar la dmar ser 'jigs par byed pa mi'u thung gsus pa 'phyang zhing 'jigs pa /
analyzed: smar la dmar ser 'jigs par byed pa mi'u thung gsus pa 'phyang zhing 'jigs pa /
translated: a yellow beard, is terrifying, has a short torso, and is frightening.

original: dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes @470b pa; lngags 'dril zhing khrag 'dzag pa /
analyzed: dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes @470b pa; lngags 'dril zhing khrag 'dzag pa /
translated: His yellow-red hair is tied up, with a coiled lock, and blood drips from it.

original: smin ma gnyer zhing drag tu bzhad pa /
analyzed: smin ma gnyer zhing drag tu bzhad pa /
translated: His eyebrows are furrowed, and he laughs fiercely.

original: mgo bos mtshan pa'i dbyug pa dkar po g-yas pa'i phyag gis 'dzin pa /
analyzed: mgo bos mtshan pa'i dbyug pa dkar po g-yas pa'i phyag gis 'dzin pa /
translated: He holds a white club marked with a head in his right hand.

original: phyag g-yon pas myos byed dang khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yon pas myos byed dang khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa 'dzin pa /
translated: His left hand holds a skull cup filled with liquor and blood.

original: nyi ma bye ba'i gzi brjid dang mnyam pa /
analyzed: nyi ma bye ba'i gzi brjid dang mnyam pa /
translated: He is equal in splendor to ten million suns.

original: g-yon brkyang ba'i zhabs kyis gnas pa /
analyzed: g-yon brkyang ba'i zhabs kyis gnas pa /
translated: He stands with his left leg extended.

original: gshin rje 'jigs shing bsdigs par mdzad pa /
analyzed: gshin rje 'jigs shing bsdigs par mdzad pa /
translated: He terrifies and threatens Yama.

original: ma he'i rgyab na gnas pa brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa can /
analyzed: ma he'i rgyab na gnas pa brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa can /
translated: He is in the form of an eight-to-twelve-year-old child seated on a water buffalo.

original: klu brgyad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: klu brgyad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with the eight nāgas.

original: mgo bo'i phreng ba dbu la bcings pa mgo bo'i phreng ba rab tu 'phyang ba /
analyzed: mgo bo'i phreng ba dbu la bcings pa mgo bo'i phreng ba rab tu 'phyang ba /
translated: He wears a garland of heads, a garland of heads hanging down.

original: stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can /
analyzed: stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can /
translated: He wears an elephant-skin skirt.

original: rdo rje phag mos 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mos 'khyud pa'o //
translated: He is embraced by Vajravārāhī.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs dang kha dog 'dra ba la gri gug dang thod pa can phyag rgya lngas rnam par brgyan pa'i lus can mar brtson pa'i sems kyis bsgom par bya zhing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs dang kha dog 'dra ba la gri gug dang thod pa can phyag rgya lngas rnam par brgyan pa'i lus can mar brtson pa'i sems kyis bsgom par bya zhing /
translated: One should visualize her as having a form and complexion like the Blessed One, holding a flaying knife and skull cup, her body adorned with the five symbolic ornaments, and with a mind intent on union.

original: de nas nga rgyal byas na bdag nyid grub bar 'gyur bar the tshom med do //
analyzed: de nas nga rgyal byas na bdag nyid grub bar 'gyur bar the tshom med do //
translated: Then, if one performs the rite of pride, one will certainly attain success.

original: de nas badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma konyham gis gsang sngags bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma konyham gis gsang sngags bklag par bya'o //
translated: Then one should recite the mantra “vajrasattva” and so forth.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das mas rjes su chags pa chen pos yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad rnam par bltas nas padmar rdo rje gsor te gnyis ka'i stag wags kyi na bza' 'phyar bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das mas rjes su chags pa chen pos yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad rnam par bltas nas padmar rdo rje gsor te gnyis ka'i stag wags kyi na bza' 'phyar bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then the Bhagavatī, with great passion, looking at all the major and minor limbs, should be imagined to wave the garments of both the tiger and the deer skin, stirring the vajra in the lotus.

original: de la 'di dag rjes su chags par byed do zhes byas nas rdo rje padma dag sems la byin nas h'um dmar po yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje rtse mor aom yig ser pos byin gyis brlabs pa rab tu bsgom par bya'o //🔽a'a:yig dmar pos padma de'i ze'u 'brur @471a *//
analyzed: de la 'di dag rjes su chags par byed do zhes byas nas rdo rje padma dag sems la byin nas h'um dmar po yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje rtse mor aom yig ser pos byin gyis brlabs pa rab tu bsgom par bya'o // a'a:yig dmar pos padma de'i ze'u 'brur @471a *//
translated: There, having said, “These are the things that arouse passion,” the vajra and lotus should be placed in the mind. One should imagine that the red hūṃ completely transforms into an oṃ syllable at the tip of the vajra, which is consecrated by the yellow oṃ syllable.🔽The lotus is consecrated by the red āḥ syllable at the tip of the lotus.

original: la a'a: yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: la a'a: yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: The lotus is consecrated by the red āḥ syllable at the tip of the lotus.

original: de nas aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na bdzra sva bh'a wa a'a tpa konyaham zhes bzlogs nas /
analyzed: de nas aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na bdzra sva bh'a wa a'a tpa konyaham zhes bzlogs nas /
translated: Then, reciting oṃ sarvatathāgatānuraktavajrasvabhāvātmako ’haṃ,

original: rdo rje padma mnyam par sbyor pa las bzhengs par bdag nyid bsgom par bya te /
analyzed: rdo rje padma mnyam par sbyor pa las bzhengs par bdag nyid bsgom par bya te /
translated: one should imagine that one arises from the union of the vajra and lotus,

original: phyi rol gyi gnyis gnyis bzhin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gnyis gnyis bzhin no //
translated: like the external couple.

original: de nas 'pho ba'i gnas skabs na bdag nyid du bsgoms pa'i lha mo'i padma'i khongs su dus mnyam par 'dzag pa'i khams gnyis 'dres par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'pho ba'i gnas skabs na bdag nyid du bsgoms pa'i lha mo'i padma'i khongs su dus mnyam par 'dzag pa'i khams gnyis 'dres par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, at the time of transference, one should meditate on the two commingled essential constituents that are simultaneously dripping into the lotus of the goddess who is visualized as oneself.

original: dkar po dang dmar po de dag yongs su gyur pas gti mug gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du padma'i dbus su bsams nas bcom ldan 'das ma las skye bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dkar po dang dmar po de dag yongs su gyur pas gti mug gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du padma'i dbus su bsams nas bcom ldan 'das ma las skye bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Those white and red [essential constituents] transform into Mohavajrā and so forth, who are imagined in the center of the lotus just like oneself, and one should meditate on their arising from the Bhagavatī.

original: de'i 'og tu de rnams mdun du bltas nas rang rang gi gnas su so sor gnas par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de rnams mdun du bltas nas rang rang gi gnas su so sor gnas par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, after looking at them in front, one should imagine them abiding in their respective places.

original: de nas shar gyi 'dab ma'i nyi ma la gti mug gshin rje gshed tsartsi k'a nag mos 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: de nas shar gyi 'dab ma'i nyi ma la gti mug gshin rje gshed tsartsi k'a nag mos 'khyud pa'o //
translated: Then, on the sun of the eastern petal, Mohavajrā is embraced by black Cācuka.

original: lho'i 'dab ma'i nyi ma la phra ma gshin rje'i gshed ser po pag mo ser mos 'khyud pa ste //
analyzed: lho'i 'dab ma'i nyi ma la phra ma gshin rje'i gshed ser po pag mo ser mos 'khyud pa ste //
translated: On the sun of the southern petal, Paiśunya-vajrā is yellow and is embraced by yellow Sūkarṣaṇa.

original: de yang phag pa'i gdong pa can no //
analyzed: de yang phag pa'i gdong pa can no //
translated: He also has the face of a pig.

original: nub kyi 'dab ma'i nyi ma la 'dod chags gshin rje'i gshed dmar po dbyangs can ma dkar mo dang sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: nub kyi 'dab ma'i nyi ma la 'dod chags gshin rje'i gshed dmar po dbyangs can ma dkar mo dang sbyor ba'o //
translated: On the sun of the petal in the west, red Rāgavajrāntaka is in union with white Sarasvatī.

original: byang gi 'dab ma'i nyi ma la phrag dog gshin rje'i gshed sdo bsangs goo r'i ma dang snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: byang gi 'dab ma'i nyi ma la phrag dog gshin rje'i gshed sdo bsangs goo r'i ma dang snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: On the sun of the petal in the north, green Iravāṇa is in union with Gaurī.🔽Alternatively, all are contemplated as red Yamāntaka and Vāyuvegā.

original: yang na thams cad kyang gshin rje'i gshed dmar po dang / ro langs ma dang mtshungs par bsgom par @471b bya'o; ;me ru mu men gyi bu ma pa bzhi mnyam sbyar bas gang ba'o //
analyzed: yang na thams cad kyang gshin rje'i gshed dmar po dang / ro langs ma dang mtshungs par bsgom par @471b bya'o; ;me ru mu men gyi bu ma pa bzhi mnyam sbyar bas gang ba'o //
translated: In the southeast is a vase filled with lapis lazuli and the four equal parts.

original: bden bral du gser gyi bum ba gla rtsis gang ba'o //🔽de bzhin du rlung du byi ru'i bum pa sihlas gang ba'o //
analyzed: bden bral du gser gyi bum ba gla rtsis gang ba'o // de bzhin du rlung du byi ru'i bum pa sihlas gang ba'o //
translated: In the southwest is a golden vase filled with musk.🔽In the same way, in the northwest is a coral vase filled with olibanum.

original: dbang ldan du dngul gyi bum pa ga bur gyis gang ba ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang ldan du dngul gyi bum pa ga bur gyis gang ba ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: In the northeast is a silver vase filled with camphor.

original: thod pa gang ba bltas nas nyi ma dang zla ba kun rdzogs pa dag la'o //
analyzed: thod pa gang ba bltas nas nyi ma dang zla ba kun rdzogs pa dag la'o //
translated: Having looked at the filled skull cup, the sun and moon are complete.

original: 'di nyid bde ba chen po dang zung du 'jug pa mchog las gzhan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid bde ba chen po dang zung du 'jug pa mchog las gzhan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not other than the supreme union with great bliss.

original: de nas rang gi snying gar padma dang / nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um yig las skyes pa de'i 'od zer rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la mchod pa kun gyis mchod nas /
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying gar padma dang / nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um yig las skyes pa de'i 'od zer rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la mchod pa kun gyis mchod nas /
translated: Then, from the letter hūṃ arisen from the lotus and sun in one’s heart, one’s light rays worship the wheel of the maṇḍala with all the offerings.

original: dza:h'um bam ho:zhes pas bden par dgug pa dang / gzhug pa la sogs pa dang mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: dza:h'um bam ho:zhes pas bden par dgug pa dang / gzhug pa la sogs pa dang mchod par bya'o //
translated: With jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, one should summon, induct, and so forth, and worship.

original: sems can rnams thams cad bla ma'i man ngag ji lta ba las so zhes rnal 'byor gnyis pa'o //🔽de nas phyogs bcur bzhugs rnal 'byor //
analyzed: sems can rnams thams cad bla ma'i man ngag ji lta ba las so zhes rnal 'byor gnyis pa'o // de nas phyogs bcur bzhugs rnal 'byor //
translated: All sentient beings are like that, according to the guru’s instruction.🔽Then, the wise one should summon the hosts of yoginīs

original: rnal 'byor ma tshogs de rnams la //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma tshogs de rnams la //
translated: residing in the ten directions,

original: blo dang ldan pas sbar bzhin dgug /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas sbar bzhin dgug /
translated: as if igniting them,

original: mchod cing dbang bskur la sogs pa //
analyzed: mchod cing dbang bskur la sogs pa //
translated: and worship them, confer empowerment, and so forth.

original: zhes te / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dbang bskur bzhin pa la spyan ma la sogs pa rnams kyis kun dga' ba'i thugs kyis sna tshogs par gyur pa'i glu la sogs pa dang gar gyis bdud rtsi lnga'i gang ba'i bum pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: zhes te / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dbang bskur bzhin pa la spyan ma la sogs pa rnams kyis kun dga' ba'i thugs kyis sna tshogs par gyur pa'i glu la sogs pa dang gar gyis bdud rtsi lnga'i gang ba'i bum pa rnams kyis /
translated: Thus, while being empowered by the Tathagatas, Locana and so forth, with a mind of joy, with songs and so forth that are various, and with dances, with vases filled with the five nectars,🔽the consecration:

original: dbang bskur rin chen chen po la //
analyzed: dbang bskur rin chen chen po la //
translated: The great jewel,

original: khams gsum pa yis phyag byas pa //🔽sangs rgyas kun gyi gsang gsum gyi //
analyzed: khams gsum pa yis phyag byas pa // sangs rgyas kun gyi gsang gsum gyi //
translated: worshipped by the three realms,🔽arisen from the place of the three secrets of all the Buddhas,

original: gnas las byung ba sbyin par bya //
analyzed: gnas las byung ba sbyin par bya //
translated: is given.

original: zhes klog cing bstod pas /
analyzed: zhes klog cing bstod pas /
translated: Reciting this, they praise.

original: dkyil 'khor ba thams cad kyi dbu la khu ba @472a *//
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba thams cad kyi dbu la khu ba @472a *//
translated: The seminal fluid that arises from the heads of all the mandala deities

original: ster du 'byung ba las /
analyzed: ster du 'byung ba las /
translated: is given to the disciples.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i rgyas btab par bsam mo //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i rgyas btab par bsam mo //
translated: One should imagine that they are sealed with Vajrasattva.🔽The rite.🔽Those who request with delusion, slander, passion, and envy,

original: cho ga'o // gti mug dang / phra ma dang / 'dod chags dang / phrag dog rnams kyis gsol ba 'debs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: cho ga'o // gti mug dang / phra ma dang / 'dod chags dang / phrag dog rnams kyis gsol ba 'debs par byed pa ni /
translated: say:

original: kye kye gshin rje'i gshed dmar po //
analyzed: kye kye gshin rje'i gshed dmar po //
translated: Oṃ, O Red Yamāri,

original: bla ma srin po'i gzugs rang bzhin //
analyzed: bla ma srin po'i gzugs rang bzhin //
translated: the nature of the guru-rākṣasa form,

original: kho bos khyod mthong rnam par 'jigs //
analyzed: kho bos khyod mthong rnam par 'jigs //
translated: I am terrified at the sight of you.

original: bla ma khro bo'i rang bzhin spongs //
analyzed: bla ma khro bo'i rang bzhin spongs //
translated: Abandon your wrathful nature, Guru!🔽Wherever you dance, the earth,

original: khyod kyis gar mdzad sa stengs dang // sa bla dang ni sa 'og g-yo //
analyzed: khyod kyis gar mdzad sa stengs dang // sa bla dang ni sa 'og g-yo //
translated: the atmosphere, and the underworld shake.🔽You are a zombie,

original: chags pas brgyan pa'i khro bo yi //🔽gar mdzad khyod ni ro langs lags //
analyzed: chags pas brgyan pa'i khro bo yi // gar mdzad khyod ni ro langs lags //
translated: dancing with wrath adorned with passion.

original: sku ni sbom thung dmar po ste //
analyzed: sku ni sbom thung dmar po ste //
translated: Your body is thickset, short, and red,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs sku sprul pa //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs sku sprul pa //
translated: emanating various forms.

original: rdo rje dbyangs can ma yis btud //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyangs can ma yis btud //
translated: I bow to you, Vajra Sarasvatī.

original: gar mdzad khyod ni bde ba che //
analyzed: gar mdzad khyod ni bde ba che //
translated: You are a dancer, you are great bliss.

original: hr'i:sht'i gsang sngags dag gis ni //
analyzed: hr'i:sht'i gsang sngags dag gis ni //
translated: With the secret mantra of Hṛṣīkeśa,

original: khyod ni sa gsum 'khrul pa sel //
analyzed: khyod ni sa gsum 'khrul pa sel //
translated: you dispel delusion in the three worlds.

original: rje btsun snying rje'i khro bo lags //
analyzed: rje btsun snying rje'i khro bo lags //
translated: You are the wrathful one of compassion, the venerable one.

original: gar mdzad khyod ni 'gro la gzigs //
analyzed: gar mdzad khyod ni 'gro la gzigs //
translated: You are a dancer, you look upon the world.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko nyham zhes so //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko nyham zhes so //
translated: Oṃ, all tathāgatas, I pay homage with the vajra nature of my own body.

original: de nas sngar bzhin du rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du me'i dkyil 'khor //
analyzed: de nas sngar bzhin du rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du me'i dkyil 'khor //
translated: Then, as before, on top of the wind maṇḍala, the fire maṇḍala

original: de'i steng du aom yig yongs su gyur pa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gsum gyi steng du a'a:yig yongs su gyur pa las thod pa bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de'i steng du aom yig yongs su gyur pa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gsum gyi steng du a'a:yig yongs su gyur pa las thod pa bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
translated: On top of that, one should visualize the skull-cup, which is the transformation of the syllable A: , above the three secret maṇḍalas, which are the transformations of the syllable Oṃ.

original: de'i dbus su bdud rtsi lnga dang / sha lnga dang / zho dang // 'o ma dang / sha dang / nyal sogs pa dbyug pas dkrugs pas ro mnyam par byas la tshos nas rgya skyegs kyi khu ba lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su bdud rtsi lnga dang / sha lnga dang / zho dang // 'o ma dang / sha dang / nyal sogs pa dbyug pas dkrugs pas ro mnyam par byas la tshos nas rgya skyegs kyi khu ba lta bur blta'o //
translated: In the middle of that, one should visualize the five ambrosias, the five meats, curd, milk, meat, molasses, and so forth, mixed together by a stick, cooked, and looking like lac juice.

original: aom a'a:h'um zhes pa 'dis bsil bar gyur par @472b byas nas h'um yig yongs su gyur pa'i lce sbu gu can bsams nas btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um zhes pa 'dis bsil bar gyur par @472b byas nas h'um yig yongs su gyur pa'i lce sbu gu can bsams nas btung bar bya'o //
translated: With this, Oṃ Aḥ Hūṃ, one should cool it, and having made it cool, one should drink it, visualizing a tube-tongue, which is the transformation of the syllable Hūṃ.

original: rang rang gi kha yis ni lha mo'i kha ru sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: rang rang gi kha yis ni lha mo'i kha ru sbyin par bya'o //
translated: One should offer it into the mouth of the goddess with one’s own mouth.

original: dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyis kyang bsams nas kun tu spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyis kyang bsams nas kun tu spyad par bya'o //
translated: The maṇḍala-beings should also visualize it and partake of it.

original: de nas bdud rtsi myangs pas yang dag par dgos par gyur nas phyi nas gsang sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bdud rtsi myangs pas yang dag par dgos par gyur nas phyi nas gsang sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, having tasted the ambrosia, one should recite the mantra again, having become fully satisfied.

original: snying gar gnas pa'i sa bon dang mtshan ma bstan par byas nas gsang sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: snying gar gnas pa'i sa bon dang mtshan ma bstan par byas nas gsang sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having shown the seed syllable and the sign located in the heart, one should recite the mantra.

original: aom hr'i:sht'i:bi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom hr'i:sht'i:bi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ hrīḥ ṣṭṛīḥ vikṛtānana hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes pas ji srid 'dod par bsams nas bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pas ji srid 'dod par bsams nas bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Recite this as much as one wishes.

original: ldang bar 'dod na rang gi lus kyi 'od zer gyis sems can gyi don byas nas thams cad bdag la rab tu bcug ste yid kyis gshin rje'i gshed lhan cig skyes pa'i rnal 'byor gyis ji ltar bde bar gnas par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ldang bar 'dod na rang gi lus kyi 'od zer gyis sems can gyi don byas nas thams cad bdag la rab tu bcug ste yid kyis gshin rje'i gshed lhan cig skyes pa'i rnal 'byor gyis ji ltar bde bar gnas par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: If one wishes to rise, having performed the welfare of sentient beings with the light rays of one’s body, having caused all to enter into oneself, one should abide in whatever way is comfortable, with the yoga of the coemergent Yamāntaka, mentally.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas skabs ni /🔽bdag nyid kyi gzugs lta bu rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i gshin rje'i gshed du rgyal byed par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas skabs ni / bdag nyid kyi gzugs lta bu rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i gshin rje'i gshed du rgyal byed par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The occasion of the yoga of the coemergent Yamāntaka🔽is said to be the victor in the form of one’s own body, the naturally accomplished Yamāntaka.

original: rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i zhal gcig pa phyag gnyis pa gshin rje gshed kho na nga'o zhes so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i zhal gcig pa phyag gnyis pa gshin rje gshed kho na nga'o zhes so //
translated: “I am just Yamāntaka, naturally accomplished, with one face and two arms.”

original: rnal 'byor chen po'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'o //
translated: This is the great yoga.

original: rnal 'byor bzhi brjod pa 'dis thun gsum nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: rnal 'byor bzhi brjod pa 'dis thun gsum nyid kyis sam /
translated: By means of this recitation of the four yogas, in three sessions or

original: thun bzhis kyang rung ste /
analyzed: thun bzhis kyang rung ste /
translated: four sessions,

original: de ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dus su rtag tu yongs su rdzogs pa'i bar ji srid du'o zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dus su rtag tu yongs su rdzogs pa'i bar ji srid du'o zhes so //
translated: in this way, at the desired time, until the completion of the recitation.

original: de nas 'bum phrag gi mthar mtshan thog thag tu bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas 'bum phrag gi mthar mtshan thog thag tu bzlas par bya ste /
translated: Then, at the end of a hundred thousand recitations, one should recite all night.

original: sngon du bsnyen par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the preliminary service.

original: de nas @473a *//
analyzed: de nas @473a *//
translated: Then,

original: las thams cad pa'i thabs kyi cho gas mar dang sbrang rtsi dang me tog dmar pos stong phrag bcur sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: las thams cad pa'i thabs kyi cho gas mar dang sbrang rtsi dang me tog dmar pos stong phrag bcur sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: by means of the method rite of the all-activity [mantra], one should offer into the fire ten thousand oblations of ghee, honey, and red flowers,

original: re re zhing gsang sngags bklags nas so //
analyzed: re re zhing gsang sngags bklags nas so //
translated: reciting the mantra for each.

original: aom hr'i:shtr'i:bi kri t'a na na mantra siddhi mme de hi t'i h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtr'i:bi kri t'a na na mantra siddhi mme de hi t'i h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ hṛiḥ śrīḥ vikṛtānana mantrasiddhi me dehi hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: de nas gsang sngags kyi sngags kyi dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas gsang sngags kyi sngags kyi dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the mantra will be accomplished.

original: las thams cad kyi dngos grub bo //
analyzed: las thams cad kyi dngos grub bo //
translated: This is the accomplishment of all activities.

original: dmar po zhes pa'i lha la sogs pa'i le'u ste dang po'o ////
analyzed: dmar po zhes pa'i lha la sogs pa'i le'u ste dang po'o ////
translated: The first chapter on the deity called Red.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Here, it is said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag rgya che'i //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag rgya che'i //
translated: How will there be the accomplishment of the great seal of the Blessed One?

original: dngos grub ji ltar 'gyur ba dang // rnam pa ci yis bsgrub bya ba //
analyzed: dngos grub ji ltar 'gyur ba dang // rnam pa ci yis bsgrub bya ba //
translated: By what kind of form should it be accomplished?

original: de'ang bcom ldan 'das gsung du gsol //
analyzed: de'ang bcom ldan 'das gsung du gsol //
translated: Please speak of that, O Blessed One.

original: kha yis kha la 'o byas nas //
analyzed: kha yis kha la 'o byas nas //
translated: Having kissed mouth to mouth,

original: phan tshun dam po yis ni 'khyud //
analyzed: phan tshun dam po yis ni 'khyud //
translated: embracing each other tightly,

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i gzugs kyis ni //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i gzugs kyis ni //
translated: with the form of supreme joy,

original: dga' ma bshad par bya yi nyon //
analyzed: dga' ma bshad par bya yi nyon //
translated: listen as I explain the beloved.

original: gar byed pa'i 'byung gnas rnal 'byor bdag nyid kyi gzugs gang yin pa /
analyzed: gar byed pa'i 'byung gnas rnal 'byor bdag nyid kyi gzugs gang yin pa /
translated: The form of the yogin, the abode of dance,

original: bcom ldan 'das mchog tu rnam par ma chad par 'bab pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mchog tu rnam par ma chad par 'bab pa ste /
translated: is the Blessed One, falling without supreme interruption,

original: dper na chu klung gi rgyun rab tu 'bab pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chu klung gi rgyun rab tu 'bab pa bzhin no //
translated: like the current of a river flowing.

original: 'dir ji srid du bsgoms pa las skyon sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ji srid du bsgoms pa las skyon sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Here, as long as there is meditation, one should recite the mantra.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs gal te myur du grub par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs gal te myur du grub par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no /
translated: If the form of the Blessed One is quickly accomplished, not otherwise.

original: ji srid du 'di'i dngos grub kyang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kho na de'o //
analyzed: ji srid du 'di'i dngos grub kyang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kho na de'o //
translated: And as long as his power is also the power of the Great Seal.

original: 'di rnams kyang rnal 'byor goms pa kho nas thams cad sgrub par byed kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang rnal 'byor goms pa kho nas thams cad sgrub par byed kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: And all of these are accomplished only by the practice of yoga, not otherwise.🔽The practice of yoga is the attainment of liberation and the attainment of the various desired aims, and even the power of Buddhahood, in this very life, of those who are born, who have arisen, who have not arisen, and who have previously abided.

original: goms pa'i @473b sbyor bar 'gyur ba ni skyes pa dang byung ba dang ma byung ba dang / sngon du gnas pa rnams thar pa'i don dang 'dod pa'i don rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang sangs rgyas nyid kyi dngos grub kyang skye ba 'di nyid la'o; ;las thams cad yongs su spangs nas der son pa'i yid du gyur nas ji srid rang nyid 'ongs nas smra🔽bar byed de /
analyzed: goms pa'i @473b sbyor bar 'gyur ba ni skyes pa dang byung ba dang ma byung ba dang / sngon du gnas pa rnams thar pa'i don dang 'dod pa'i don rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang sangs rgyas nyid kyi dngos grub kyang skye ba 'di nyid la'o; ;las thams cad yongs su spangs nas der son pa'i yid du gyur nas ji srid rang nyid 'ongs nas smra bar byed de /
translated: Having abandoned all actions, having gone there with a mind that has arrived, he will come and speak to you himself.

original: kye kye sgrub pa po mchog ci yin pa de scal bar bgyi'o //🔽de nas mchod yon byin nas phyag byas te dngos grub blang bar byas ba de sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: kye kye sgrub pa po mchog ci yin pa de scal bar bgyi'o //🔽de nas mchod yon byin nas phyag byas te dngos grub blang bar byas ba de sbyin par byed do //
translated: “O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O, O,

original: aom hr'i:sht'i:bi kri t'a na na a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom hr'i:sht'i:bi kri t'a na na a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ hṛiḥ śrīḥ vikṛtānana āgaca āgaca hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: de nas rdo rje ro langs ma sgrub par 'dod na /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje ro langs ma sgrub par 'dod na /
translated: Then, if one wishes to perform the sādhana of Vajravetālī,

original: rdo rje langs ma'i gzugs brnyan byas te ras sam 'bras bu la byas te /
analyzed: rdo rje langs ma'i gzugs brnyan byas te ras sam 'bras bu la byas te /
translated: one should make an image of Vajravetālī, made of cloth or fruit,

original: rje btsun gyi kha dog dang dbyibs su thog mar yang dag par gnas te ji ltar 'byor pa'i mchod pa byas te /
analyzed: rje btsun gyi kha dog dang dbyibs su thog mar yang dag par gnas te ji ltar 'byor pa'i mchod pa byas te /
translated: and, having first correctly established the color and form of the venerable one, one should make offerings according to one’s means.

original: de dag rang rang so so'i gzugs ma 'dres pas kun tu mthong ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag rang rang so so'i gzugs ma 'dres pas kun tu mthong ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra until one sees her in her own individual form, unmixed with others.

original: ji srid du 'ongs nas sgrub pa po la 'khyud de smras pa /
analyzed: ji srid du 'ongs nas sgrub pa po la 'khyud de smras pa /
translated: As long as she arrives, embraces the practitioner, and says,

original: kye sgrub pa po khyod kyi bka' bsgo pa ci lags /
analyzed: kye sgrub pa po khyod kyi bka' bsgo pa ci lags /
translated: “Oh practitioner, what is your command?”

original: sgrub pa pos mchod yon byin nas smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa pos mchod yon byin nas smra bar bya ste /
translated: The practitioner should give her an offering and say,

original: bdag gi chung mar 'gyur ba'o zhes pas chung mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi chung mar 'gyur ba'o zhes pas chung mar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Become my wife.” She will become one’s wife.

original: de la longs spyad pas gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs su grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la longs spyad pas gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs su grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By enjoying her, one will attain the form of Yamāntaka.

original: aom dve sha ra ti a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha nu da nu da tru ta tru ta h'um dza:sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom dve sha ra ti a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha nu da nu da tru ta tru ta h'um dza:sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ, Veśa-rati, come, come! Nudati nudati! Truṭati truṭati! Hūṃ jaḥ svāhā.

original: yang na aom bdzra be tta li a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um dza:sv'a h'a /
analyzed: yang na aom bdzra be tta li a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um dza:sv'a h'a /
translated: Or else, Oṃ, Vajra-vetālī, come, come! Hūṃ jaḥ svāhā.

original: gzhon nu ma lo bcu drug lon pa yan lag bzang mo bag mar blangs pas @474a *//
analyzed: gzhon nu ma lo bcu drug lon pa yan lag bzang mo bag mar blangs pas @474a *//
translated: A girl of sixteen years, with good limbs, is taken as a bride.

original: sam; skyed nas skal ldan mar byas te /
analyzed: sam; skyed nas skal ldan mar byas te /
translated: Having given birth, she is made a suitable woman.

original: dbang bskur ba'i rnal 'byor ma sngags kyi sgom pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i rnal 'byor ma sngags kyi sgom pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par mchod de /
translated: Having made a perfect offering with the method of mantra meditation of the yoginī consecration,

original: lag pa g-yon pas 'khyung la rnal 'byar ma'i gzugs su bsams na sa ji srid du 'bar bar gyur ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pas 'khyung la rnal 'byar ma'i gzugs su bsams na sa ji srid du 'bar bar gyur ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: one should hold her with the left hand, imagining her in the form of a yoginī, and recite the mantra for as long as she blazes.

original: de nas de la bzung nas gshin rje'i gshed kyi gzugs su grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas de la bzung nas gshin rje'i gshed kyi gzugs su grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having taken hold of her, she becomes accomplished in the form of Yamāntaka.

original: aom bdzra betta li dzva lam h'um dza:sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom bdzra betta li dzva lam h'um dza:sv'ah'a /
translated: Oṃ, Vajra-vetālī, blaze, blaze! Hūṃ jaḥ svāhā.

original: zhes bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite this.

original: de nas gti mug gshin rje'i gshed sgrub par 'dod na gti mug gshin rje'i gshed kyi cha lugs su byas nas g-yas pa dang gcig shos kyi rkang pa'i mthil gyis padma mnan te /
analyzed: de nas gti mug gshin rje'i gshed sgrub par 'dod na gti mug gshin rje'i gshed kyi cha lugs su byas nas g-yas pa dang gcig shos kyi rkang pa'i mthil gyis padma mnan te /
translated: Then, if one wishes to accomplish Delusion-Yamântaka, having assumed the guise of Delusion-Yamântaka, one should tread on a lotus with the soles of one’s right and left feet.

original: ji srid du kye sgrub pa po zhes bos nas bka' bsgo ba ci lags zhes smra bar byed pa dang / ci bgyi bar 'gyur zhes smra ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid du kye sgrub pa po zhes bos nas bka' bsgo ba ci lags zhes smra bar byed pa dang / ci bgyi bar 'gyur zhes smra ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra until he says, “O practitioner, what is your command?” and “What shall I do?”

original: de nas brtsams te 'jig rten gsum gyi rgyal srid kyang ster ro //
analyzed: de nas brtsams te 'jig rten gsum gyi rgyal srid kyang ster ro //
translated: Beginning from then, he will grant even the kingdom of the three worlds,

original: dngos grub gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos /🔽de bzhin du phra ma gshin rje'i gshed dang / 'dod chags gshin rje'i gshed /
analyzed: dngos grub gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos / de bzhin du phra ma gshin rje'i gshed dang / 'dod chags gshin rje'i gshed /
translated: to say nothing of other powers.🔽In the same way, if one wishes to accomplish Slander-Yamântaka, Passion-Yamântaka,

original: phrag dog gshin rje'i gshed sgrub par 'dod na /
analyzed: phrag dog gshin rje'i gshed sgrub par 'dod na /
translated: and Envy-Yamântaka,

original: de bzhin nyid du 'bras bu sgrub pa'i gsang sngags ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du 'bras bu sgrub pa'i gsang sngags ni /
translated: the secret mantra for accomplishing the fruit in the same way is:🔽“Oṃ, Mohavajrā, grant, grant!

original: aom mo h'a ya m'a nta kri ta a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um h'um phat phat/
analyzed: aom mo h'a ya m'a nta kri ta a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um h'um phat phat/
translated: Hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ!”

original: aom bi shu na ya m'anta krita a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um h'um phat phat/🔽aom r'a ga ya m'anta kri a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um h'um phat phat/
analyzed: aom bi shu na ya m'anta krita a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um h'um phat phat/ aom r'a ga ya m'anta kri a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um h'um phat phat/
translated: Oṃ viśva-yamāntakṛta āgaca āgaca hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ.🔽Oṃ rāga-yamāntakṛta āgaca āgaca hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ.

original: aom a'i rshya ya m'a nta krit a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'i rshya ya m'a nta krit a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ īrṣya-yamāntakṛta āgaca āgaca hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes bzlas par @474b bya'o /
analyzed: zhes bzlas par @474b bya'o /
translated: One should recite in this way.

original: de nas gti mug dga' ma sgrub par 'dod na gti mug dga' ma lta bu'i sngar brjod pa'i lha mo'i gzugs ma he la zhon pa bdag nyid dang lhan cig ba byas nas sngar bzhin du mnan te /
analyzed: de nas gti mug dga' ma sgrub par 'dod na gti mug dga' ma lta bu'i sngar brjod pa'i lha mo'i gzugs ma he la zhon pa bdag nyid dang lhan cig ba byas nas sngar bzhin du mnan te /
translated: Then, if one wishes to accomplish the delight of delusion, one should visualize oneself mounted on a water buffalo, like the delight of delusion, the previously described goddess, and press down as before.

original: ji srid du 'ongs nas ci bgyi bar 'gyur ro zhes smra ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid du 'ongs nas ci bgyi bar 'gyur ro zhes smra ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite until she arrives and says, “What should I do?”

original: de nas brtsams nas sgrub pa po mngon par 'dod pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de nas brtsams nas sgrub pa po mngon par 'dod pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: From that time on, the practitioner will be fulfilled with the perfection of his desires.

original: de bzhin du phra ma dga' ma dang / 'dod chags dga' ma dang / phrag dog dga' ma bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phra ma dga' ma dang / 'dod chags dga' ma dang / phrag dog dga' ma bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should accomplish the beloved of slander, the beloved of passion, and the beloved of envy.

original: de nas sngags ni /
analyzed: de nas sngags ni /
translated: Then, the mantras:

original: aom mo h'a ra ti a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um dza:/🔽aom bi shu n'a ra ti a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um dza:/🔽aom r'a g'a ra ti a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um dza:/
analyzed: aom mo h'a ra ti a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um dza:/ aom bi shu n'a ra ti a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um dza:/ aom r'a g'a ra ti a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um dza:/
translated: Oṃ, summon, summon Moharatī, hūṃ jaḥ!🔽Oṃ, summon, summon Viśvaratī, hūṃ jaḥ!🔽Oṃ, summon, summon Rāgaratī, hūṃ jaḥ!

original: aom a'irshya ra ti a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um dza:/
analyzed: aom a'irshya ra ti a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um dza:/
translated: Oṃ, summon, summon Aiṣīkaratī, hūṃ jaḥ!

original: zhes bzlas bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bzlas bar bya'o //
translated: One should recite in this way.

original: yang na / aom bdzra tsa rtsi ke a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um dza:/
analyzed: yang na / aom bdzra tsa rtsi ke a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha h'um dza:/
translated: Or else: Oṃ, summon, summon Vajra-cārvīkī, hūṃ jaḥ!

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way:

original: bdzra w'a r'a h'i /🔽bdzra sva ra sva sti /
analyzed: bdzra w'a r'a h'i / bdzra sva ra sva sti /
translated: Vajra-vārāhī,🔽Vajra-śvetāsitā,🔽Vajra-gaurī.

original: bdzra goo r'i zhes bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: bdzra goo r'i zhes bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite in this way.

original: de nas gnod sbyin sgrub par 'dod na /
analyzed: de nas gnod sbyin sgrub par 'dod na /
translated: Then, if one wishes to accomplish the yakṣas,

original: de'i tshe 'jig rten gyi dngos grub sgrub pa'i 'du shes kyis gnod sbyin gyi gzugs brnyan byas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'jig rten gyi dngos grub sgrub pa'i 'du shes kyis gnod sbyin gyi gzugs brnyan byas te /
translated: at that time, with the perception of accomplishing worldly powers, one should make an image of the yakṣa,

original: de mnan te bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de mnan te bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: and suppress it and accomplish it.

original: bka' bsgo ba thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bka' bsgo ba thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the commands will be fulfilled.

original: de bzhin du gnod sbyin mo dang / klu dang / klu mo dang / yi dvags dang / yi dvags mo dang / sha za dang / sha za mo dang / lha dang / lha mo dang / mi dang / mi mo yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnod sbyin mo dang / klu dang / klu mo dang / yi dvags dang / yi dvags mo dang / sha za dang / sha za mo dang / lha dang / lha mo dang / mi dang / mi mo yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, the yakṣiṇīs, nāgas, nāgīs, pretas, pretīs, piśācas, piśācīs, devas, devīs, humans, and human females will be summoned.

original: gzhan yang mngon du bsgrubs par byas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon du bsgrubs par byas te /
translated: Moreover, one should accomplish the summoning of the others.

original: aom hr'i:shtr'i:bi kri t'a na na che ge mo s'a dha ya sa dha ya h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtr'i:bi kri t'a na na che ge mo s'a dha ya sa dha ya h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ hṛiḥ śṛiḥ vikṛtānana, make such-and-such a person come, come!

original: zhes bzlas par bya'o //🔽de nas rdo rje dbyug pa /
analyzed: zhes bzlas par bya'o // de nas rdo rje dbyug pa /
translated: Recite this.

original: @475a *// sgrub par 'dod na /
analyzed: @475a *// sgrub par 'dod na /
translated: Then, if one wishes to accomplish the vajra club,

original: skar ma rgyal la rdo rje'i dbyug pa shing las byung ba sor mo sum cu pa'i dbyug pa byas nas ba byung lngas byugs te tsandan dang / me tog gi phros bas nye bar mdzes par byas te /
analyzed: skar ma rgyal la rdo rje'i dbyug pa shing las byung ba sor mo sum cu pa'i dbyug pa byas nas ba byung lngas byugs te tsandan dang / me tog gi phros bas nye bar mdzes par byas te /
translated: one should make a vajra club from wood, thirty finger-widths long, anoint it with the five products of the cow, and adorn it with sandalwood and flower garlands.

original: gang de thog mar ral gri'i tshul gyis bzung nas ji srid du 'bar bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: gang de thog mar ral gri'i tshul gyis bzung nas ji srid du 'bar bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: First, one should hold it in the manner of a sword, and recite the mantra as long as it blazes.

original: de nas dbyug pa 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas dbyug pa 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, one should hold it in the manner of a club.

original: gshin rje'i gshed dang mtshungs par pha rol gnon to //
analyzed: gshin rje'i gshed dang mtshungs par pha rol gnon to //
translated: One will be able to overpower others, like Yamântaka.🔽The mantra is:

original: aom hr'i:shtr'i:bi kri t'a na na bdzra danda dzva la ya dzva la ya h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtr'i:bi kri t'a na na bdzra danda dzva la ya dzva la ya h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ hrīḥ ṣṭṛīḥ vikṛtānana vajra-daṇḍa jvālā-jvālā hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite this.

original: de nas thod bsgrub par 'dod na gshin rje'i gshed shing gi gzugs thod pa sor mo sum cu so gnyis pa byas nas sngar bzhin du lag pa g-yon pas thogs te /
analyzed: de nas thod bsgrub par 'dod na gshin rje'i gshed shing gi gzugs thod pa sor mo sum cu so gnyis pa byas nas sngar bzhin du lag pa g-yon pas thogs te /
translated: Then, if one wishes to perform the sādhana of the skull, one should make a wooden image of Yamântaka, a skull with thirty-two fingers, and hold it in the left hand as before.

original: lag pa g-yas bas g-yogs nas ji srid du 'bar bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas bas g-yogs nas ji srid du 'bar bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Covering it with the right hand, one should recite the mantra as long as it blazes.

original: 'bras bu ni de lta bu kho na'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni de lta bu kho na'o //
translated: The result is just like that.

original: sngags la ni /
analyzed: sngags la ni /
translated: In the mantra,

original: ka p'a lam dzv'a la ya zhes pa khyad par ro //
analyzed: ka p'a lam dzv'a la ya zhes pa khyad par ro //
translated: the difference is “ka-pāla-jvālāya.”

original: de nas dbyug ba'i phyag rgya bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas dbyug ba'i phyag rgya bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should perform the sādhana of the club.

original: de'i tshe lag pa g-yas pa khu tshur byas nas sdigs mdzub brkyang par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe lag pa g-yas pa khu tshur byas nas sdigs mdzub brkyang par bya'o //
translated: At that time, one should make a fist with the right hand and extend the index finger.

original: de'i phyag rgya bcings nas ji srid du 'bar bar 'gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyag rgya bcings nas ji srid du 'bar bar 'gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having formed that seal, one should recite the mantra for as long as it blazes.

original: de nas gshin rje'i gshed kyi gzugs kyi dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas gshin rje'i gshed kyi gzugs kyi dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, one will attain the power of the form of Yamântaka.

original: sngags la ni /
analyzed: sngags la ni /
translated: The mantra is:

original: dandam mu tr'am dzv'a la ya /
analyzed: dandam mu tr'am dzv'a la ya /
translated: danda-mutraṃ jvālāya.

original: zhes pa khyad par ro //
analyzed: zhes pa khyad par ro //
translated: This is the special [mantra].

original: 'di ni / 'dod pa lnga po thams cad la nye bar longs spyod pa nyid kyis thams cad @475b bsgrub par bya'o zhes te /🔽ji ltar rnyed pa'i dam tshig gi rdzas bsam pa rab tu rdzogs pa'i don du bza' bar bya zhing /
analyzed: 'di ni / 'dod pa lnga po thams cad la nye bar longs spyod pa nyid kyis thams cad @475b bsgrub par bya'o zhes te / ji ltar rnyed pa'i dam tshig gi rdzas bsam pa rab tu rdzogs pa'i don du bza' bar bya zhing /
translated: This [practice] should be accomplished by all means through the enjoyment of all five desires.

original: btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: btung bar bya'o //
translated: One should eat and drink the pledge substances obtained in any way, for the sake of fulfilling one's wishes.

original: yang nas yang du gang ci'ang rung //
analyzed: yang nas yang du gang ci'ang rung //
translated: Again and again, whatever it may be,

original: de kun gdon mi za bar yang //🔽bza' bya thams cad btung bar bya //
analyzed: de kun gdon mi za bar yang // bza' bya thams cad btung bar bya //
translated: all of that without doubt🔽should be eaten and drunk.

original: phung kun gshin rje'i gshed la dbul //
analyzed: phung kun gshin rje'i gshed la dbul //
translated: All the aggregates are offered to Yamântaka.

original: zhes pa dngos grub chen po sgrub pa'i cho ga'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o ////
analyzed: zhes pa dngos grub chen po sgrub pa'i cho ga'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o ////
translated: This is the second chapter on the ritual of accomplishing the great powers.

original: de nas dngos grub phran tshegs sgrub par 'dod na /
analyzed: de nas dngos grub phran tshegs sgrub par 'dod na /
translated: Now, if one wishes to accomplish the minor powers,

original: de la zhi ba can la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de la zhi ba can la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: one should accomplish the peaceful and so forth.

original: grog la yang lan brgya rtsa brgyad du bsngags pa'i 'o mas rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i 'khor lo so so tha dad pa mngon par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: grog la yang lan brgya rtsa brgyad du bsngags pa'i 'o mas rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i 'khor lo so so tha dad pa mngon par bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw twelve separate wheels with spokes, each one hundred and eight times enchanted with milk,

original: de'i shar sgo nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de'i shar sgo nas brtsams te /
translated: beginning from the eastern gate.

original: g-yas bskor gyis yi ge bcu gnyis bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas bskor gyis yi ge bcu gnyis bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should write the twelve syllables,

original: aom hr'i:shtr'i:bi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat/
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtr'i:bi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat/
translated: om hriḥ śrīḥ vikṛtānana hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ,

original: dbus su chu'i sa bon bam yig bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: dbus su chu'i sa bon bam yig bri bar bya ste /
translated: in the center one should write the water seed syllable vaṃ,

original: bam yig gnyis kyi kha sbyar la bsgrub bya'i ming de'i dbus su bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: bam yig gnyis kyi kha sbyar la bsgrub bya'i ming de'i dbus su bri bar bya'o //
translated: and in the middle of the two joined vaṃ syllables one should write the name of the person to be accomplished.

original: phyi rol tu yi ges bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol tu yi ges bskor bar bya'o //
translated: One should surround it with the syllables on the outside.

original: de nas kha sbyor du byas nas skud pa dkar pos dkris nas myos byed kyis dkris te brgya rtsa brgyad du byin gyis brlabs la 'o mas gang ba'i bum par bcug ste /
analyzed: de nas kha sbyor du byas nas skud pa dkar pos dkris nas myos byed kyis dkris te brgya rtsa brgyad du byin gyis brlabs la 'o mas gang ba'i bum par bcug ste /
translated: Then, having made it into a pair, having wrapped it with a white thread, having wrapped it with intoxicating [substances], having consecrated it one hundred and eight times, having placed it in a vase filled with milk,

original: sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: one should recite the mantra.

original: ji ltar 'byor pa'i mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: ji ltar 'byor pa'i mchod pa byas nas /
translated: Having made offerings according to one's means,

original: aom hr'i:shtra'i:bi kri t'a na na ba de ba datta sya sh'antim ku ru h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtra'i:bi kri t'a na na ba de ba datta sya sh'antim ku ru h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: one should recite the mantra, Om hrīḥ śrīḥ vikṛtānana bhañja bhañja deva datta śāntiṃ kuru hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes bzlas pa bya ste zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bzlas pa bya ste zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be pacified.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi sdig pa dang nad yla sogs pa nye bar 'tshe ba grong gi phyogs bcu rnams su /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi sdig pa dang nad yla sogs pa nye bar 'tshe ba grong gi phyogs bcu rnams su /
translated: With regard to the harm of the world, such as the harm of sin, disease, and so forth, in the ten directions of the village,

original: aom hr'i:shtr'i: @476a *//
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtr'i: @476a *//
translated: Om hrīḥ śrīḥ

original: bi kri t'a na na gr'a ma aa mu ka sya sarbo pa dra wa sh'a ntim ku ru ku ru h'um h'um ba lim grihna grihna phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: bi kri t'a na na gr'a ma aa mu ka sya sarbo pa dra wa sh'a ntim ku ru ku ru h'um h'um ba lim grihna grihna phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: vikṛtānana garja amuka sarvopa-drava śāntiṃ kuru kuru hūṃ hūṃ baliṃ gṛhaṇa gṛhaṇa phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes pa 'dis lan bdun du byin gyis brlabs nas gtor ma'i che gas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis lan bdun du byin gyis brlabs nas gtor ma'i che gas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Having consecrated it seven times with this, one should give it with the tip of a bali offering.

original: phyi rol la sogs pa sngon du byas te 'o mas sbags pa'i sbyin sreg grong gi dbus ji srid par byas na nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol la sogs pa sngon du byas te 'o mas sbags pa'i sbyin sreg grong gi dbus ji srid par byas na nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having performed the external rites, etc., and having made a burnt offering of milk, one should do this as long as in the middle of the village, and all calamities will be pacified.

original: de nas rgyas par bya bar 'dod na //
analyzed: de nas rgyas par bya bar 'dod na //
translated: Then, if one wishes to do the rite of enriching,

original: sngar bzhin du 'khor lo gnyis mngon par bris te yi ge bcu gnyis po rnams kyi dbus su bhr'um yig dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i sa bon bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bzhin du 'khor lo gnyis mngon par bris te yi ge bcu gnyis po rnams kyi dbus su bhr'um yig dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i sa bon bri bar bya'o //
translated: one should draw two wheels as before, and in the middle of the twelve syllables one should write the seed syllable of the wheel of the maṇḍala, bhrūṃ.

original: de'i dbus su bsgrub bya'i bo shat gnyis kha sbyar ba bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su bsgrub bya'i bo shat gnyis kha sbyar ba bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the middle of that one should write the two bosṭa of the victim to be enchanted, facing each other.

original: phyi rol du gur gum gyis gru bzhi pa'i ri mo gsum gyis bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du gur gum gyis gru bzhi pa'i ri mo gsum gyis bskor bar bya'o //
translated: Outside one should draw a square with saffron, surrounded by three lines.

original: de skud pa ser pos dkris nas brgya rtsa brgyad du mngon par bsngags te /
analyzed: de skud pa ser pos dkris nas brgya rtsa brgyad du mngon par bsngags te /
translated: Having wrapped it with yellow thread, one should incant it one hundred and eight times.

original: mar dang sbrang rtsis gang ba'i bum par bcug nas sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: mar dang sbrang rtsis gang ba'i bum par bcug nas sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having placed it in a vase filled with ghee and honey, one should recite the mantra.

original: ji ltar 'byor pa'i mchod pa byas nas sngags bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'byor pa'i mchod pa byas nas sngags bzlas par bya ste /
translated: Having made offerings according to one’s means, one should recite the mantra.

original: aom hr'i:sht'i:be kri t'a na na bhr'um boo shat lha sbyin gyi pu shtim ku ru boo shat h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom hr'i:sht'i:be kri t'a na na bhr'um boo shat lha sbyin gyi pu shtim ku ru boo shat h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ hṛīḥ śrīḥ vikṛtānana bhruṃ bhouḥ svāhā. May you, god so-and-so, increase the wealth! Bhouḥ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite this.

original: ji srid du nor 'phel zhing rgyas par gyur gyi bar du'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du nor 'phel zhing rgyas par gyur gyi bar du'o zhes pa'o //
translated: As long as the wealth increases and expands.

original: sngags bzlas pa'i bar ma chad par zho'i zan gyis sbyin sreg bya'o //🔽de nas dbang du byed par 'dod na sngar bzhin du 'khor lo gnyis la sen rtsi'i khu bas yi ge bcu gnyis po rnams mngon par @476b bris te /
analyzed: sngags bzlas pa'i bar ma chad par zho'i zan gyis sbyin sreg bya'o // de nas dbang du byed par 'dod na sngar bzhin du 'khor lo gnyis la sen rtsi'i khu bas yi ge bcu gnyis po rnams mngon par @476b bris te /
translated: Without interruption in the recitation of the mantra, one should perform a homa with rice and milk.

original: dbus su hr'i:yig ku ru kulle'i sa bon no //
analyzed: dbus su hr'i:yig ku ru kulle'i sa bon no //
translated: Then, if one wishes to enthrall, one should write the twelve syllables with vermillion on two wheels, as before, and in the middle, the syllable hṛīḥ and the seed syllable of Kurukullā.

original: dbus su ho:yig gnyis kha sbyar ba kun bri'o //
analyzed: dbus su ho:yig gnyis kha sbyar ba kun bri'o //
translated: In the middle, one should write the two syllables hoḥ joined together.

original: phyi rol tu gru gsum pa'i ri mos bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol tu gru gsum pa'i ri mos bskor bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw this on the outside, surrounded by a triangular line.

original: de nas srad bu dmar pos kun tu dkris nas brgya rtsa brgyad du byin gyis brlabs la ma mar dang sbrang rtsis gang ba'i kham phor la rgya skyegs kyi khu bas bris te bcug nas ji ltar 'byor ba'i mchod pa byas nas sngags bzlas par bya'o /
analyzed: de nas srad bu dmar pos kun tu dkris nas brgya rtsa brgyad du byin gyis brlabs la ma mar dang sbrang rtsis gang ba'i kham phor la rgya skyegs kyi khu bas bris te bcug nas ji ltar 'byor ba'i mchod pa byas nas sngags bzlas par bya'o /
translated: Then, having completely wrapped it with red thread, one should consecrate it one hundred and eight times. Having placed it in a bowl filled with curds and honey, one should write with lac juice, and make offerings according to one’s means. One should recite the mantra.

original: aom hr'i:shtt'i:pi kri t'a na na hr'i:ho //
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtt'i:pi kri t'a na na hr'i:ho //
translated: Oṃ hṛiḥ śṛiḥ piṅgala-anana hṛiḥ hoḥ.

original: lha sbyin gyis lha sbyin la /
analyzed: lha sbyin gyis lha sbyin la /
translated: [One should recite] “Devadatta’s Devadatta

original: wa sha m'a na ya ho:h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: wa sha m'a na ya ho:h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: vaśaṃ ānaya hoḥ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.”

original: zhes ji srid dbang du gyur gyi bar du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes ji srid dbang du gyur gyi bar du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite until [the target] is brought under control.

original: sngags bzlas pa'i mthar ni /
analyzed: sngags bzlas pa'i mthar ni /
translated: At the end of the recitation of the mantra,

original: lan tshva dang lhan cig pa'i me tog dmar po dang ldan pa'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: lan tshva dang lhan cig pa'i me tog dmar po dang ldan pa'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: one should perform a homa with red flowers together with salt.

original: de nas gong bu dgug par sems na dur khrod kyi sol ba dang sa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dbus su sngags dang de nyid kyi ming snying gar bcug ste /
analyzed: de nas gong bu dgug par sems na dur khrod kyi sol ba dang sa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dbus su sngags dang de nyid kyi ming snying gar bcug ste /
translated: Then, if one wishes to summon a lump, in the middle of a figure of the target made from charnel ground ash and earth, one should insert the mantra and his name in the heart.

original: rkang pa'i mthe bos mnan nas bzlas pa bya ste /
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthe bos mnan nas bzlas pa bya ste /
translated: Pressing down with the big toe, one should recite.

original: 'di kho na bsgrub bya'i gong bu zhes ji srid du gong bu khugs par gyur gyi bar du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di kho na bsgrub bya'i gong bu zhes ji srid du gong bu khugs par gyur gyi bar du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: This alone is the object of the rite, and one should recite for as long as the object is summoned.

original: sngags la ni; wa sha m'a na ya'i gnas s'a a'a karsha ya h'um zhes pa dang / ho:yig gnas su dza:zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sngags la ni; wa sha m'a na ya'i gnas s'a a'a karsha ya h'um zhes pa dang / ho:yig gnas su dza:zhes pa ni /
translated: In the mantra, the place of vaśamāna is replaced by ākarṣaya hūṃ, and the place of hoḥ is replaced by jaḥ.

original: khyad par ro //
analyzed: khyad par ro //
translated: This is the special feature.

original: aom marme marm'a aa bi gha te aom tsa rtsi ke ha ra ha ra bu kkam m'a ra ya m'a ra ya che ge mo'i ched du dza: aom gam bhi ri tsa rtsi ge pa h'um sho ni ta pr'i ye gam bh'i ra che ge mo la dza:/🔽shing gcig gam dur khrod dam ri bom ru lhor mngon par phyogs pas gcer bur byung nas brgya rtsa @477a *//
analyzed: aom marme marm'a aa bi gha te aom tsa rtsi ke ha ra ha ra bu kkam m'a ra ya m'a ra ya che ge mo'i ched du dza: aom gam bhi ri tsa rtsi ge pa h'um sho ni ta pr'i ye gam bh'i ra che ge mo la dza:/ shing gcig gam dur khrod dam ri bom ru lhor mngon par phyogs pas gcer bur byung nas brgya rtsa @477a *//
translated: Oṃ marmamarmāvihate oṃ carcikī harahara bukkaṃ māraya māraya for the sake of so-and-so jaḥ. Oṃ ghaṃbhīracīrṇapāriśoṇita-parye ghaṃbhīra so-and-so jaḥ.

original: brgyad du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: brgyad du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: At a solitary tree, a charnel ground, or a mountain, facing south, one should recite one hundred and eight times, naked.

original: de nas 'grub par the tshom med do //
analyzed: de nas 'grub par the tshom med do //
translated: Then, there is no doubt of success.

original: bcom ldan 'das sngags kyi cho ga ji lta bu /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sngags kyi cho ga ji lta bu /
translated: Blessed One, what is the procedure of the mantra?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: dben par gcig pu can du gyur pas rje btsun gyi bris sku rab tu gsal ba'i phyogs bcur gnas pa'i bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon sum du byas nas mi'i rus pa bcad pa dang / khrag chen po dang /
analyzed: dben par gcig pu can du gyur pas rje btsun gyi bris sku rab tu gsal ba'i phyogs bcur gnas pa'i bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon sum du byas nas mi'i rus pa bcad pa dang / khrag chen po dang /
translated: Having become solitary in solitude, having visualized the painting of the venerable one, having visualized the gurus, buddhas, and bodhisattvas abiding in the ten directions, one should cut the bone of a human, and with the great blood

original: bya rog chen po'i khrag gis sor mo bcu gnyis pa'i rtibs bcu gnyis pa'i rnam pa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su rlung gi sa bon no //
analyzed: bya rog chen po'i khrag gis sor mo bcu gnyis pa'i rtibs bcu gnyis pa'i rnam pa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su rlung gi sa bon no //
