original: so sor nges bstan nyan par 'dod //
analyzed: so sor nges bstan nyan par 'dod //
translated: Each is taught for the sake of listening.

original: de de sangs rgyas spyod yul zhes //
analyzed: de de sangs rgyas spyod yul zhes //
translated: That is said to be the domain of the Buddha.

original: slob dpon 'dir brjod gnas pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dir brjod gnas pa'o //
translated: The master taught this here.

original: nyon mongs las dang sdug bsngal rnams //
analyzed: nyon mongs las dang sdug bsngal rnams //
translated: Afflictions, karma, and suffering

original: zhes pas ji srid bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pas ji srid bsdus pa'o //
translated: are summarized in this way.

original: de la gnyis dag gis lhag pa'i bcu so sor bstan pa la /
analyzed: de la gnyis dag gis lhag pa'i bcu so sor bstan pa la /
translated: There, the two teach the remainder.

original: yan lag ces pa 'di dag gi cha shas kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: yan lag ces pa 'di dag gi cha shas kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The limbs are the distinctions of the parts of these.

original: dper na / aam ga pam ga'i dngos po'i khyad par ni bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: dper na / aam ga pam ga'i dngos po'i khyad par ni bsngags pa'o //
translated: For example, the particular thing of the mango is praised.

original: zhes te / aam ga ni /
analyzed: zhes te / aam ga ni /
translated: Here, mango

original: khyad par ro //
analyzed: khyad par ro //
translated: is a particular.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid 'khrig pa las thub pa des ni thub pas so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid 'khrig pa las thub pa des ni thub pas so //
translated: The Sage, having been restrained by body, speech, and mind, by the Sage.

original: bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching

original: rab tu gsal bar gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu gsal bar gsungs pa'o //
translated: is well-spoken.

original: zhes pa rnam grags so //
analyzed: zhes pa rnam grags so //
translated: Thus it is well-known.

original: de rnams kyi gtso bo dang / rang bzhin dang / dbang @502b phyug tu nges pa dang / phyogs skyong ba dang / ngo bo nyid la sogs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gtso bo dang / rang bzhin dang / dbang @502b phyug tu nges pa dang / phyogs skyong ba dang / ngo bo nyid la sogs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: They are not determined as the chief, nature, lord, guardian of the directions, essence, and so on,

original: yan lag bcu gnyis kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis kyi khyad par ro //
translated: but as the particularities of the twelve limbs.

original: de lta mod kyi nyon mongs pa rnams la las dang sdug bsngal rnams su ste /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi nyon mongs pa rnams la las dang sdug bsngal rnams su ste /
translated: However, the afflictions are in the actions and sufferings,

original: phan tshun bstan pa dbyug gu gsum gyi tshul gyis gsum rnams su ji lta ba bzhin du bsdus nas 'gro ste /
analyzed: phan tshun bstan pa dbyug gu gsum gyi tshul gyis gsum rnams su ji lta ba bzhin du bsdus nas 'gro ste /
translated: and they are included in the three just as they are in the manner of the three sticks mutually demonstrated.

original: dper na chu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chu bzhin no //
translated: For example, like water.

original: slar yang nyon mongs pa rnams dang / las rnams dang / sdug bsngal dang / de rnams ji lta ba bzhin du 'di gsum bsdus nas ji ltar 'gro zhe na /
analyzed: slar yang nyon mongs pa rnams dang / las rnams dang / sdug bsngal dang / de rnams ji lta ba bzhin du 'di gsum bsdus nas ji ltar 'gro zhe na /
translated: Again, how do the three of affliction, action, and suffering go?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: dang po brgyad dgu nyon mongs 'gyur; ;zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dang po brgyad dgu nyon mongs 'gyur; ;zhes pa ni /
translated: The first, eighth, and ninth are affliction.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di rnams kyi khyad par gyi dang rnam dang ba ma rig pa dang / brgyad pa sred pa dang / dgu pa nye bar len pa zhes pa gsum po 'di rnams nyon mongs pa so sor bsdus par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di rnams kyi khyad par gyi dang rnam dang ba ma rig pa dang / brgyad pa sred pa dang / dgu pa nye bar len pa zhes pa gsum po 'di rnams nyon mongs pa so sor bsdus par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that three of these twelve members are included in the afflictions: the first, ignorance; the eighth, craving; and the ninth, grasping.

original: gnyis pa bcu pa las yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa bcu pa las yin te /
translated: The second and tenth are action.

original: yang ci 'du byed ni /🔽gnyis pa'o // srid pa ni /
analyzed: yang ci 'du byed ni / gnyis pa'o // srid pa ni /
translated: Again, what is the second?🔽It is karmic formation.🔽What is the tenth?

original: bcu pa'o // 'di dag las su bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bcu pa'o // 'di dag las su bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is becoming. These two are included in action.

original: lhag ma bdun ni sdug bsngal yin //
analyzed: lhag ma bdun ni sdug bsngal yin //
translated: The remaining seven are suffering.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / las su bsdus pa 'da rnams kyi lhag ma gang yin pa'i yan lag gi khyad par bdun ni //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / las su bsdus pa 'da rnams kyi lhag ma gang yin pa'i yan lag gi khyad par bdun ni //
translated: The seven remaining members that are different from those included in the afflictions and action are the three of🔽consciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, birth, and aging and death.

original: sdug bsngal du bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal du bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as included in suffering.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / skye ba dang / rga shi yang ngo zhes @503a *//
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / skye ba dang / rga shi yang ngo zhes @503a *//
translated: consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense spheres, contact, feeling, birth, and old age and death.

original: pa ste / yang gi sgra rab tu sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: pa ste / yang gi sgra rab tu sbyor ba ni /
translated: The word “also” is used

original: bsdu ba yang dag par rab tu sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba yang dag par rab tu sbyor ba ste /
translated: to indicate that the inclusion is complete.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams sdug bsngal du yang dag par sdud par byed do //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams sdug bsngal du yang dag par sdud par byed do //
translated: Ignorance, etc., are included in suffering.

original: de bzhin chos bcu gnyis po 'di rnams thams cad ni /
analyzed: de bzhin chos bcu gnyis po 'di rnams thams cad ni /
translated: In this way, all twelve factors

original: nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba gsum du bsdus te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba gsum du bsdus te /
translated: are included in the three groups called afflictions, actions, and sufferings.

original: dman pa dang lhag pa yod pa ma yin par shes par byed pa'i don las so //
analyzed: dman pa dang lhag pa yod pa ma yin par shes par byed pa'i don las so //
translated: The word “only” is used to indicate that there are no other factors.

original: ni'i sgra ni /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni /
translated: The word “just”

original: 'di rnams mdo ru nges par bstan pa de srid du yongs su bgrangs pa 'di dag mchog tu yod do zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams mdo ru nges par bstan pa de srid du yongs su bgrangs pa 'di dag mchog tu yod do zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: is used to indicate that the enumeration of these factors is definite.

original: ci ste gang las 'di rnams las dang nyon mongs rnams kyis dang / las dang sdug bsngal rnams kyis 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gang las 'di rnams las dang nyon mongs rnams kyis dang / las dang sdug bsngal rnams kyis 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if you ask, “How do they arise from karma and affliction, and from karma and suffering?”

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gsum rnams zlas dbyer 'gyur ba ni /🔽zlas dbye ba las 'gyur ro //🔽bdun pa nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsum rnams zlas dbyer 'gyur ba ni / zlas dbye ba las 'gyur ro // bdun pa nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The three arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.

original: gsum rnams su zlas dbye bar 'gyur ro //🔽las zhes bya ba zlas dbyer 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsum rnams su zlas dbye bar 'gyur ro // las zhes bya ba zlas dbyer 'gyur te /
translated: The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.

original: zlas dbye ba las rab tu 'gyur ba 'khor na'o //🔽sdug bsngal zhes pa sngar bzhin du nges par bstan pa las bdun pa gsum 'byung ste /
analyzed: zlas dbye ba las rab tu 'gyur ba 'khor na'o // sdug bsngal zhes pa sngar bzhin du nges par bstan pa las bdun pa gsum 'byung ste /
translated: The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba rnams su nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba gnyis po de nyid ni /🔽rab tu 'khor bar byed pas srid pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba rnams su nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba gnyis po de nyid ni / rab tu 'khor bar byed pas srid pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: The seven arise from the combination of two.

original: de la srid pa ni /🔽las kyi gzugs @503b kyis sgra gcan no //
analyzed: de la srid pa ni /🔽las kyi gzugs @503b kyis sgra gcan no //
translated: The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.🔽The seven arise from the combination of two.

original: de yang ming gsum pa can 'dir 'khor lo byung ba las 'jig rten bdun po der yongs su 'khor bar byed do //
analyzed: de yang ming gsum pa can 'dir 'khor lo byung ba las 'jig rten bdun po der yongs su 'khor bar byed do //
translated: Moreover, the wheel arises here with three names, and it causes the seven worlds to revolve.

original: ni'i sgra ni /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni /
translated: The word ni

original: nges pa'i don no //
analyzed: nges pa'i don no //
translated: is of definitive meaning.

original: dper na / zla ba shar du yongs su 'khor bar byed pa bzhin //
analyzed: dper na / zla ba shar du yongs su 'khor bar byed pa bzhin //
translated: For example, just as the moon causes the wheel to revolve in the east.

original: srid pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: It is the wheel of existence.

original: de bzhin du rdzogs par 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzogs par 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, it does not arise completely.

original: de lta mod kyi nges pa ni med do //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi nges pa ni med do //
translated: However, there is no certainty.

original: zhes pas ni sgra'o //
analyzed: zhes pas ni sgra'o //
translated: This is the sound.

original: de nas da ni lus can thams cad dbang phyug byed pa po dang / byed pa ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: de nas da ni lus can thams cad dbang phyug byed pa po dang / byed pa ci yin zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the lord, the agent, and the action of all embodied beings?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be said:

original: 'gro ba thams cad phan tshun du rgyu dang 'bras bu yang 'ga' zhig kyang 'dir med de /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad phan tshun du rgyu dang 'bras bu yang 'ga' zhig kyang 'dir med de /
translated: In all worlds, there is no cause and effect at all here,

original: sems can la gzhan du nye bar btags pa las so /
analyzed: sems can la gzhan du nye bar btags pa las so /
translated: but only in relation to sentient beings.

original: rgyu'i yang 'di yongs su byed pa la rgyur nye bar btags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: rgyu'i yang 'di yongs su byed pa la rgyur nye bar btags pa tsam mo //
translated: The cause is also merely designated as a cause in relation to its function.

original: de'i phyir rdzas gzhan la sems can du bden no zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzas gzhan la sems can du bden no zhes so //
translated: Therefore, it is true that sentient beings are substantially different.

original: de nas da ni gnas pa'i 'jig rten las pha rol gyi 'jig rten du rjes su 'gro ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: de nas da ni gnas pa'i 'jig rten las pha rol gyi 'jig rten du rjes su 'gro ba ci zhe na /
translated: Now, what is it that goes from this world to the next world?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: This is what should be said:

original: 'jig rten pha rol gyi don tsam yang dngos po ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gyi don tsam yang dngos po ste /
translated: The mere fact that there is an afterlife is a thing.

original: 'pho ba ni med do //
analyzed: 'pho ba ni med do //
translated: But there is no transmigration.

original: 'on kyang stong pa kho na yis stong pa'i chos rnams rab tu 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang stong pa kho na yis stong pa'i chos rnams rab tu 'byung ste /
translated: However, phenomena that are empty of intrinsic reality arise from causes that are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: 'pho ba yang med do //
analyzed: 'pho ba yang med do //
translated: But there is no transmigration.

original: chos rnams las ni /
analyzed: chos rnams las ni /
translated: From phenomena that are empty of intrinsic reality🔽the seven phenomena that are empty of “I” and “mine” arise.🔽But there is no transmigration.

original: bdag gi ba med pa'i nyon mongs dang las kyi ming can lnga po rnams las bdag dang dag gi bas stong pa'i 'bras bu'i ming can bdun po'i chos rnams rab tu 'byung ste /
analyzed: bdag gi ba med pa'i nyon mongs dang las kyi ming can lnga po rnams las bdag dang dag gi bas stong pa'i 'bras bu'i ming can bdun po'i chos rnams rab tu 'byung ste /
translated: In this way, the seven phenomena that are empty of “I” and “mine” arise from the five phenomena that are empty of intrinsic reality and are called “afflictions” and “actions.”

original: 'pho ba yang med do zhes pa de lta bur 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du bdag tu gnas pa rnams las @504a *//
analyzed: 'pho ba yang med do zhes pa de lta bur 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du bdag tu gnas pa rnams las @504a *//
translated: But there is no transmigration.

original: rang bzhin dang bral ba'i stong pa'i chos bdun po rnams rab tu 'byung ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bral ba'i stong pa'i chos bdun po rnams rab tu 'byung ste /
translated: In this way, the seven phenomena that are empty of intrinsic reality arise from the five phenomena that are empty of intrinsic reality and are called “afflictions” and “actions.”

original: 'pho ba yang med do //
analyzed: 'pho ba yang med do //
translated: But there is no transmigration.

original: de'ang 'di dag bstan pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: de'ang 'di dag bstan pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the point of teaching this?

original: 'dir brjod par byas te /🔽legs par klog dang sgron me rgya //
analyzed: 'dir brjod par byas te / legs par klog dang sgron me rgya //
translated: Here, I will explain:🔽Reading well, lamp,

original: me long sgra dang nyi ma 'pho //
analyzed: me long sgra dang nyi ma 'pho //
translated: mirror, sound, sun, transference,

original: sa bon mig gis ngas bstan pa //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sa bon mig gis ngas bstan pa // zhes pa ni /
translated: seed, eye—I have taught.

original: de kho na nyid las 'gro ba med pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis bdag kyang med de /
analyzed: de kho na nyid las 'gro ba med pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis bdag kyang med de /
translated: This means that there is no going from reality, and there is no self by nature.

original: tha snyad du 'jig rten pha rol yod do //
analyzed: tha snyad du 'jig rten pha rol yod do //
translated: Conventionally, there is a world beyond.

original: zhes pa'o // dper na /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // dper na /
translated: For example,

original: bla ma las klog par byed pa ni /
analyzed: bla ma las klog par byed pa ni /
translated: reading from a teacher

original: 'pho ba yang med de /
analyzed: 'pho ba yang med de /
translated: is not transference.

original: de'i dngos po bla ma las klog pa nyams pa med la /
analyzed: de'i dngos po bla ma las klog pa nyams pa med la /
translated: The reality of that reading from a teacher is not lost.

original: slob mas klog pa yang nyams pa med cing /
analyzed: slob mas klog pa yang nyams pa med cing /
translated: The reading of the student is not lost.

original: slob mas klog pa gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: slob mas klog pa gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The reading of the student is not something else.

original: de bzhin du kun tu 'byung bar byed na /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun tu 'byung bar byed na /
translated: Likewise, if it were to arise completely,

original: rgyu med pa can gyi nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa can gyi nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the fault of causelessness would follow.

original: de bzhin du 'chi bar byed pa'i sems ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'chi bar byed pa'i sems ni /
translated: Likewise, the mind that dies

original: 'jig rten pha rol tu 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol tu 'gro ba med de /
translated: does not go to a world beyond,

original: rtag pa'i nyes par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i nyes par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the fault of permanence would follow.

original: 'jig rten pha rol gzhan kho na las 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gzhan kho na las 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the world arises from another world,

original: dper na / bla ma las klog par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan can ni /
analyzed: dper na / bla ma las klog par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan can ni /
translated: just as the reading of a student is based on the reading of his teacher.

original: slob ma'i klog par byed pa'o //🔽de nyid de las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du de'o zhes nus pa mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: slob ma'i klog par byed pa'o // de nyid de las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du de'o zhes nus pa mngon par brjod do //
translated: The reading of the student is not other than the reading of the teacher.

original: de bzhin du de 'chi ba'i mthar thug pa'i sems la bsten nas skye ba'i cha shas can gyi sems de nyid @504b gzhan ma yin no //🔽de bzhin de yang nus pa mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du de 'chi ba'i mthar thug pa'i sems la bsten nas skye ba'i cha shas can gyi sems de nyid @504b gzhan ma yin no // de bzhin de yang nus pa mngon par brjod do //
translated: In the same way, the mind that is the beginning of a new birth is based on the mind that is the end of a previous death, and that mind is not other than that mind.🔽In the same way, the reading of the student is based on the reading of the teacher, and that reading is not other than that reading.

original: dper na / mar me las mar me'o //
analyzed: dper na / mar me las mar me'o //
translated: For example, a lamp is based on another lamp,

original: rgya las phyir rgya'o //
analyzed: rgya las phyir rgya'o //
translated: an imprint is based on a seal,

original: bzhin las me long lnga las gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: bzhin las me long lnga las gzugs brnyan no //
translated: a reflection is based on a mirror,

original: sgra las brag ca'o //
analyzed: sgra las brag ca'o //
translated: an echo is based on a sound,

original: nyi ma dang nor bu'i 'od dang bud shing rnams las me'o //
analyzed: nyi ma dang nor bu'i 'od dang bud shing rnams las me'o //
translated: fire is based on the sun, a gem, and fuel,

original: sa bon las myu gu'o //
analyzed: sa bon las myu gu'o //
translated: and a sprout is based on a seed.

original: dper na shu ga'i 'bras bu zos pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis gzhan gyis kha 'dzag pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes rab tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na shu ga'i 'bras bu zos pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis gzhan gyis kha 'dzag pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes rab tu shes par bya'o //
translated: For example, it should be understood that the fruit of the cucumber is not different from the dripping of the cucumber.

original: de bzhin du phung po las phyir phung po 'pho ba med pa yang mkhas pa rnams kyis kun tu dpyad pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po las phyir phung po 'pho ba med pa yang mkhas pa rnams kyis kun tu dpyad pa'o zhes so //
translated: In the same way, the wise should investigate that the aggregates do not transfer from this world to the next.

original: de la phung po ni /
analyzed: de la phung po ni /
translated: Here, the aggregates are

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i ming can 'di rnams kyi phung po nyid mtshams sbyor ba 'di dag phung po lnga po rnams su nges par brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i ming can 'di rnams kyi phung po nyid mtshams sbyor ba 'di dag phung po lnga po rnams su nges par brtag par bya ste /
translated: these things called form, feeling, conception, formation, and consciousness. The aggregates are definitely to be examined as the five aggregates.

original: rgyu med pa can yang ma yin la gzhan las 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa can yang ma yin la gzhan las 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not causeless, nor do they arise from another.

original: 'jig rten 'di las 'jig rten 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di las 'jig rten 'dod pa yin no //
translated: This world is the desire realm.

original: de nas mig kyang dngos po 'pho ba med do //
analyzed: de nas mig kyang dngos po 'pho ba med do //
translated: Then, the eye does not transfer to an object.

original: 'di de srid du 'du byed 'khor ba'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: 'di de srid du 'du byed 'khor ba'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the process of the cyclic existence of formations.

original: yang gi sgra ni /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni /
translated: The word “also”

original: ldog pa ste /
analyzed: ldog pa ste /
translated: is a negation.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci log tu rtogs pa 'di bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci log tu rtogs pa 'di bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this misconception should be understood.

original: gang gi phyir rtag tu sdug bsngal stong pa'i bdag nyid can gyi dngos po yin pa de'i phyir so sor kun tu rtog pa'i dngos po la kun tu rmongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag tu sdug bsngal stong pa'i bdag nyid can gyi dngos po yin pa de'i phyir so sor kun tu rtog pa'i dngos po la kun tu rmongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because things are always of the nature of suffering and emptiness, therefore one does not become confused about the nature of things as they are discriminated.

original: rmongs pa med pa'i yid rtag tu skye bar mi byed do //🔽srung ba @505a *//
analyzed: rmongs pa med pa'i yid rtag tu skye bar mi byed do // srung ba @505a *//
translated: The mind that is not confused does not always generate.

original: med pas nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pas nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no guarding, there is no fault.

original: gdug pa med pas rtag tu sdig pa'i las su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdug pa med pas rtag tu sdig pa'i las su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no malice, one does not always commit evil actions.

original: las su gyur pa'i dngos po nye bar mi len no //
analyzed: las su gyur pa'i dngos po nye bar mi len no //
translated: One does not take up things that are actions.

original: nye bar len pa med pa dang mngon par 'du byad pa med do //
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa dang mngon par 'du byad pa med do //
translated: Because there is no taking up, there is no conditioning.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gdags pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gdags pa med do //
translated: There is no designation of things and non-things.

original: ma skyes pa'i phung po la yid rnams sdug bsngal rnams su mi 'gyur ro; ;de bzhin du 'dir rnam pa lnga po 'di'i rgyu'i zas byin pa las 'dir 'bras bu rnam pa bdun thob kyi gzhan med pa las mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phung po la yid rnams sdug bsngal rnams su mi 'gyur ro; ;de bzhin du 'dir rnam pa lnga po 'di'i rgyu'i zas byin pa las 'dir 'bras bu rnam pa bdun thob kyi gzhan med pa las mi 'byung ngo //
translated: In the same way, here, the seven results are obtained from the gift of the causal food of this fivefold [giving], but not from anything else.

original: de yang thar pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang thar pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: And that is called liberation.

original: de bzhin du dad pa dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / 'pho ba la sogs pa rnams rtag tu lta ba ngan pa dang gya nom pa rnams mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du dad pa dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / 'pho ba la sogs pa rnams rtag tu lta ba ngan pa dang gya nom pa rnams mi 'byung ngo //
translated: In the same way, faith, permanence, annihilation, transmigration, and so on, and all bad views and good things never arise.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yang 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yang 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: The Blessed One also said this in verse here:

original: rkyen las 'byung ba ma mthong zhing //
analyzed: rkyen las 'byung ba ma mthong zhing //
translated: Not seeing arising from conditions,

original: don nyid kyis ni tshor ba med //🔽skye ba dang ni 'jig pa yang //
analyzed: don nyid kyis ni tshor ba med // skye ba dang ni 'jig pa yang //
translated: and not seeing the object itself,

original: gang gis 'byung bar rnam par brtags //
analyzed: gang gis 'byung bar rnam par brtags //
translated: one imagines the arising of what is born and perishes.

original: 'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
analyzed: 'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
translated: There is nothing here to be removed,

original: gzhag par bya ba cung zad med //🔽yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba cung zad med // yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
translated: and nothing at all to be added.🔽See reality in reality,

original: yang dag mthong na rnam par grol //
analyzed: yang dag mthong na rnam par grol //
translated: and when reality is seen, one is liberated.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i le'u ste bcu drug pa'o ////
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i le'u ste bcu drug pa'o ////
translated: Chapter Sixteen: Dependent Origination

original: kha sbyor gyi tshul gyis kyang gnas pa la 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i 'jig rten gyi 'dzag pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: kha sbyor gyi tshul gyis kyang gnas pa la 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i 'jig rten gyi 'dzag pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: The bliss of emission in the world of Jambudvipa is also maintained by the method of union.

original: de rnams tshe brgya pa lo brgya'i che rnams @505b so //
analyzed: de rnams tshe brgya pa lo brgya'i che rnams @505b so //
translated: Those [gods] live for a hundred years, a quarter of a hundred years.

original: bcom ldan 'das bud med med pa las ji ltar khu ba rengs par 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bud med med pa las ji ltar khu ba rengs par 'gyur /
translated: Blessed One, how can semen be immobilized without a woman?

original: khu ba rengs pa dang bral bas tshe ring po rjes su 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: khu ba rengs pa dang bral bas tshe ring po rjes su 'gro ba med do //
translated: Without the immobilization of semen, there is no attainment of longevity.

original: de'i phyir 'og nas steng du rlung gi rgyu ba rjes su bcing bar byed pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'og nas steng du rlung gi rgyu ba rjes su bcing bar byed pa las /
translated: Therefore, below, the movement of the wind is bound in sequence,

original: srog brtan par byas pa la lus la rgas pa dang 'chi ba mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: srog brtan par byas pa la lus la rgas pa dang 'chi ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: and by stabilizing the life force, aging and death do not occur in the body.

original: dang por lus dag par gyur nas chos kyi phyag rgya rab tu bsgrub par bya'o; ;phyi'i dga' ba gang dang 'dra ba de dang 'dra ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dang por lus dag par gyur nas chos kyi phyag rgya rab tu bsgrub par bya'o; ;phyi'i dga' ba gang dang 'dra ba de dang 'dra ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: First, having purified the body, one should accomplish the Dharma mudra. One should meditate on whatever is similar to external joy.

original: de bzhin du slar yang rnal 'byor pas lus kyi phyag rgya'i dga' ba rtsom pa la rkang pa g-yon pas tshangs pa'i skud pa kun tu bcir nas kha steng du byas nas h'a yig rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du slar yang rnal 'byor pas lus kyi phyag rgya'i dga' ba rtsom pa la rkang pa g-yon pas tshangs pa'i skud pa kun tu bcir nas kha steng du byas nas h'a yig rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the yogi should again commence the joy of the body-consort, crushing the brahma-thread with the left foot, and visualizing the syllable HA above the mouth.

original: slar yang s'ita yig byas nas h'um yig snying gar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang s'ita yig byas nas h'um yig snying gar gnas pa'o //
translated: Again, having made the syllable SIT, the syllable HUM abides in the heart.

original: a'a: yig slar yang bsgom par bya'o; ;'dab ma brgyad pa ge sar dang bcas pa de'i dbus su hr'i: yig 'bar ba de la 'od zer dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: a'a: yig slar yang bsgom par bya'o; ;'dab ma brgyad pa ge sar dang bcas pa de'i dbus su hr'i: yig 'bar ba de la 'od zer dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Again, one should meditate on the syllable A. In the center of that eight-petaled lotus with filaments, the syllable HRĪḤ blazes with light.

original: de las nges par byung ba'i ri mo dkar po nges par 'byung ba slar yang 'ongs te padma 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi pa'i dbus su son par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de las nges par byung ba'i ri mo dkar po nges par 'byung ba slar yang 'ongs te padma 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi pa'i dbus su son par bsam par bya'o //
translated: From that, a white line definitely emerges, and again returns, and one should imagine it arrives in the center of the sixty-four-petaled lotus.

original: slar yang aa yig bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: slar yang aa yig bsam par bya ste /
translated: Again, one should imagine the syllable A.

original: rnal 'byor pas srog gi rlung slar yang bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas srog gi rlung slar yang bcang bar bya'o //
translated: The yogi should again hold the life-wind.

original: de'i phyogs su lha mor gsal ba'i tshangs pa'i mdud pa nges par byung nas bha ga dang snying gar yang ldan par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyogs su lha mor gsal ba'i tshangs pa'i mdud pa nges par byung nas bha ga dang snying gar yang ldan par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the knot of Brahmā, which is clearly manifest as the goddess, arises in that direction, and that it is also present in the bhaga and the heart.

original: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa de la phyogs su dma @506a *//🔽por bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa de la phyogs su dma @506a *// por bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that in that eight-petaled lotus, in the directions,🔽are the four goddesses, Locanā, etc.

original: me'i zur du me dang de bzhin du slar yang rlung du'o //
analyzed: me'i zur du me dang de bzhin du slar yang rlung du'o //
translated: In the southeast corner is Māmakī, and likewise again in the northwest.

original: dbang ldan du sngon po yang ngo //
analyzed: dbang ldan du sngon po yang ngo //
translated: In the northeast is Pāṇḍaravāsinī,

original: de bzhin du srin po'i zur du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du srin po'i zur du'o //
translated: and likewise in the southwest.

original: de'i dbus su son pa'i h'um yig kha dog nag po 'od zer dmar po can no //
analyzed: de'i dbus su son pa'i h'um yig kha dog nag po 'od zer dmar po can no //
translated: In its center is a black syllable hūṃ, with red light-rays.

original: de las nges par byung ba'i ri mo spyi bor son pa rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de las nges par byung ba'i ri mo spyi bor son pa rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the line, which arises from that, reaches the crown of one’s head.

original: 'og dang steng du h'um yig kha dog nag po 'od zer dang bcas pa der son pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og dang steng du h'um yig kha dog nag po 'od zer dang bcas pa der son pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the black syllable hūṃ, together with the light-rays, reaches the soles of the feet and the palms of the hands.

original: ri mo 'bar bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: ri mo 'bar bar byed pa ni /
translated: The line that causes the blazing

original: yang nas yang du de bzhin no //
analyzed: yang nas yang du de bzhin no //
translated: is likewise again and again.

original: de'i tshe khyogs bya ba'i sgom pa bla ma'i man ngag las so //
analyzed: de'i tshe khyogs bya ba'i sgom pa bla ma'i man ngag las so //
translated: At that time, the meditation on the palanquin is from the guru’s instruction.

original: de'i tshe gtum mo 'bar bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsregs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gtum mo 'bar bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsregs te /
translated: At that time, the fire burns all the Tathagatas.

original: ri bong can 'dzag pa 'og gi bha ga la dga' ba chen po'i bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri bong can 'dzag pa 'og gi bha ga la dga' ba chen po'i bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The moon drips into the bhaga below, which is the bliss of great joy.

original: slar yang gnyis gnyis steng du 'gro ba'i don du srog dang thur sel 'gog pa las sems stong pa la nges par sbyar nas myos par byed do //
analyzed: slar yang gnyis gnyis steng du 'gro ba'i don du srog dang thur sel 'gog pa las sems stong pa la nges par sbyar nas myos par byed do //
translated: Again, in order to go up with the two, the life and the downward-voiding [winds], one should stop them, and by uniting the mind with emptiness, one should be intoxicated.

original: slar yang sems myos par gyur pa ji srid du 'khyil ba bcings pa'i sbyor ba las /
analyzed: slar yang sems myos par gyur pa ji srid du 'khyil ba bcings pa'i sbyor ba las /
translated: Again, as long as the mind is intoxicated, one should bind the coiled binding.

original: de'i tshe 'khor ba las 'bad pas kun nas g-yas su 'khor ba med par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khor ba las 'bad pas kun nas g-yas su 'khor ba med par bya ste /
translated: At that time, one should prevent the effort of samsara from turning to the right.

original: slar yang kho da'i sgra nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: slar yang kho da'i sgra nye bar gnas so //
translated: Again, the sound of the Khö is present.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo la h'um yig gi n'a da sa slar yang gnas su rab tu bkug nas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo la rtsa gnyis rab tu g-yo bar byas nas slar yang @506b brtan par bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo la h'um yig gi n'a da sa slar yang gnas su rab tu bkug nas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo la rtsa gnyis rab tu g-yo bar byas nas slar yang @506b brtan par bcing bar bya'o //
translated: In the dharmacakra, the nada of the letter HŪM is drawn back to its place. Again, the two nāḍīs are shaken in the sambhogacakra, and again one should bind firmly.

original: g-yon pa gnyis po de la zhu bar gyur par de'i tshe 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yon pa gnyis po de la zhu bar gyur par de'i tshe 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The two on the left melt into it.

original: de la yang dag par sbyangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang dag par sbyangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then it is purified.

original: slar yang ye shes kyi 'khor lo la srub par byed pa dang / 'o byed pa ni /
analyzed: slar yang ye shes kyi 'khor lo la srub par byed pa dang / 'o byed pa ni /
translated: Again, the churning of the wheel of wisdom and the kissing

original: bla ma'i man ngag las so //
analyzed: bla ma'i man ngag las so //
translated: are from the guru’s instruction.

original: slar yang 'khor lo gsum po myos par byed pa'i sbyor bas sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang 'khor lo gsum po myos par byed pa'i sbyor bas sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: Again, the three wheels are purified by the practice of intoxication.

original: steng du song ba de la bde ba chen po brtan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: steng du song ba de la bde ba chen po brtan par 'gyur te /
translated: When it goes upward, great bliss is stabilized.

original: 'di rnams lam gyi mchog ste phul du byung ba'i lha rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams lam gyi mchog ste phul du byung ba'i lha rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: These are the supreme path, not the domain of the best of gods.

original: gang zhig shes pa bsod nams dang ldan pa dang / 'jig rten gsum dang bcas pas mchod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig shes pa bsod nams dang ldan pa dang / 'jig rten gsum dang bcas pas mchod par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who knows this is meritorious and is worshipped by the three worlds.

original: lo gcig tu goms pas ches phra ba'i lus su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo gcig tu goms pas ches phra ba'i lus su 'gyur ro //
translated: Through practice for one year, the body becomes very subtle.

original: sgra chen po'i rang bzhin rab tu smra'o //
analyzed: sgra chen po'i rang bzhin rab tu smra'o //
translated: One speaks with a loud voice.

original: de bzhin du sems phra ba'i rang bzhin dang 'dod pa'i don la kun tu rgyu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems phra ba'i rang bzhin dang 'dod pa'i don la kun tu rgyu ste /
translated: Likewise, the mind has a subtle nature and moves to the object of desire.

original: gdul bya'i ched du rgya mtsho dang nam mkha' la yang 'gro'o //
analyzed: gdul bya'i ched du rgya mtsho dang nam mkha' la yang 'gro'o //
translated: For the sake of disciples, he goes to the ocean and the sky.

original: gang 'dod pa de byed do //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa de byed do //
translated: He does whatever is desired.🔽He delights in the peak of good intellect.

original: blo bzang rtse bar byed cing dga' bar byed do zhes gshin rje'i gshed dmar po'i rgyud du goms pa'i le'u ste bcu bdun pa'o ////
analyzed: blo bzang rtse bar byed cing dga' bar byed do zhes gshin rje'i gshed dmar po'i rgyud du goms pa'i le'u ste bcu bdun pa'o ////
translated: This is the seventeenth chapter of the Tantra of Red Yamantaka, the chapter on familiarization.

original: bcom ldan 'das mas gsol pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mas gsol pa /
translated: The Blessed Lady said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kye /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kye /
translated: Blessed One,🔽please speak, Lord, about the various shows and so forth.

original: ltad mo la sogs pa mnga' bdag gsung du gsol; sbyor ba sna tshogs ma lus nyid //
analyzed: ltad mo la sogs pa mnga' bdag gsung du gsol; sbyor ba sna tshogs ma lus nyid //
translated: The complete variety of yogas,

original: de bzhin dus kyi mtshan nyid dang // rang gzugs lus kyi 'khrul 'khor ni //
analyzed: de bzhin dus kyi mtshan nyid dang // rang gzugs lus kyi 'khrul 'khor ni //
translated: the characteristics of time, and the bodily yantras of one's own form,

original: da lta bka' drin mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: da lta bka' drin mdzad du gsol //
translated: please be kind and teach them now.

original: de nas bcom ldan @507a *//🔽'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan @507a *// 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said:

original: lha mo legs so legs par byas //
analyzed: lha mo legs so legs par byas //
translated: Goddess, well done, well done!

original: khyod kyis gang gzhan byas te bshad //
analyzed: khyod kyis gang gzhan byas te bshad //
translated: What else have you done that you speak thus?

original: aom dzv'a la ka r'a la pa da ne sarb'a satva h'a la h'a la badzre su badzre sph'a ra sph'a ra ya sph'a ra ya sarba me gha b'a ta /
analyzed: aom dzv'a la ka r'a la pa da ne sarb'a satva h'a la h'a la badzre su badzre sph'a ra sph'a ra ya sph'a ra ya sarba me gha b'a ta /
translated: Om jvalakalapa-dane sarva-sattva hala hala vajra su vajra sphara sphara yaya sarva megha vata vata hum hum phat phat svāhā.

original: brishti stvambha ya spho ta ya spho ta ya gha: gha: gha: sarba p'a n'i yam sho sha ya h'um phat/
analyzed: brishti stvambha ya spho ta ya spho ta ya gha: gha: gha: sarba p'a n'i yam sho sha ya h'um phat/
translated: bṛśaṃ stambhaya sphuṭa sphuṭa gha gha gha sarvapāṇiṃ śoṣaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: gsang sngags 'di dag bzlas par bya zhing khro bo'i lta stangs kyis nam mkha' la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags 'di dag bzlas par bya zhing khro bo'i lta stangs kyis nam mkha' la blta bar bya'o //
translated: Reciting these secret mantras, one should look at the sky with a wrathful gaze.

original: rlung dang sprin la sogs pa 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: rlung dang sprin la sogs pa 'joms par byed do //
translated: It will destroy wind, clouds, and so forth.

original: aom phat k'a ra phem ha ha h'a h'a phat aom hr'i: sht'i bi kram t'a na na sa rba kro dh'a na k'i la ya k'i la ya badzra dande na a'a ko ta ya a'a ko ta ya h'um h'um phat phat sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom phat k'a ra phem ha ha h'a h'a phat aom hr'i: sht'i bi kram t'a na na sa rba kro dh'a na k'i la ya k'i la ya badzra dande na a'a ko ta ya a'a ko ta ya h'um h'um phat phat sv'ah'a /
translated: Oṃ phaṭ kāra pheṃ ha ha ha ha phaṭ oṃ hṛiḥ śrīvikṛtānanasaṃ sarvakrodhāṃ kālaya kālaya vajradadane ākoṭaya ākoṭaya hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: hr'i: brjod nas lha'i bdag nyid kyi rdul rnam pa bdun sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: hr'i: brjod nas lha'i bdag nyid kyi rdul rnam pa bdun sbyin par bya ste /
translated: Having uttered hṛiḥ, one should offer the seven types of dust of one's own deity.

original: sbrul 'bros par byed do //
analyzed: sbrul 'bros par byed do //
translated: It will cause the snake to flee.

original: aom ya m'anta ka hr'i:shtv'i h'um h'um phat phat tr'a sa ya tr'a sa ya tsanda tsanda pra tsanda pra tsanda h'um phat/
analyzed: aom ya m'anta ka hr'i:shtv'i h'um h'um phat phat tr'a sa ya tr'a sa ya tsanda tsanda pra tsanda pra tsanda h'um phat/
translated: Oṃ yamāntaka hṛiḥ śrīḥ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ trāsa trāsa caṇḍa caṇḍa pracaṇḍa pracaṇḍa hūṃ phaṭ.

original: ces pas ma he 'bros par byed do //
analyzed: ces pas ma he 'bros par byed do //
translated: It will cause the buffalo to flee.

original: aom ma ma brda ne ma rda ya ma rda ya tsanda ma h'a ro sha na h'um phat/
analyzed: aom ma ma brda ne ma rda ya ma rda ya tsanda ma h'a ro sha na h'um phat/
translated: Oṃ māma bharana maya bharana maya candra mahāroṣaṇa hūṃ phaṭ.

original: zhes pa 'dis sdig pa'i nad 'joms so //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis sdig pa'i nad 'joms so //
translated: By this, the disease of sin is destroyed.

original: aom kro dha na sam kro dha ya sam kro dha ya sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom kro dha na sam kro dha ya sam kro dha ya sv'ah'a /
translated: Oṃ krodhaṃ saṃkrodhaya saṃkrodhaya svāhā.

original: zhes pa gshin rje'i gshed dmar po'i rgyud kyi rgyal por sngags kyi las rab 'byam gyi le'u ste bco brgyad pa'o ////
analyzed: zhes pa gshin rje'i gshed dmar po'i rgyud kyi rgyal por sngags kyi las rab 'byam gyi le'u ste bco brgyad pa'o ////
translated: This is the eighteenth chapter, on the extensive rites of the mantra, from “The Tantra of the King of Red Yamāri.”

original: lha mos gsol pa /
analyzed: lha mos gsol pa /
translated: The goddess said:

original: kye bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “O Blessed One,

original: gtum po chen po khros pa zhes bya ba'i khro bo chen po'i dbang phyug de'i sngags kyi @507b las rab 'byams gsung du gsol /
analyzed: gtum po chen po khros pa zhes bya ba'i khro bo chen po'i dbang phyug de'i sngags kyi @507b las rab 'byams gsung du gsol /
translated: please teach the extensive rites of the mantra of that great lord of wrath, the great wrathful one called ‘Great Caṇḍa Aṭṭahāsa.’

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said:

original: dpa' bo chen po mi g-yo ba /
analyzed: dpa' bo chen po mi g-yo ba /
translated: “The great hero Acala,

original: 'jigs pa'i yang 'jigs par byed pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i dpa' bo ral gri dang sdigs mdzub 'chang ba gtum po khros pa chen po'i nga rgyal du byas nas sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i yang 'jigs par byed pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i dpa' bo ral gri dang sdigs mdzub 'chang ba gtum po khros pa chen po'i nga rgyal du byas nas sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: the terrifier of the terrible, adorned with all ornaments, the hero holding a sword and threatening mudrā, having assumed the pride of the great wrathful one Caṇḍa Aṭṭahāsa, one should recite the mantra.

original: aom tsanda mah'a ro sha na h'um phat/
analyzed: aom tsanda mah'a ro sha na h'um phat/
translated: Oṃ caṇḍa mahāroṣaṇa hūṃ phaṭ.

original: ces pa'i gsang sngags chen po gang gi dpung par son cing gnas pa de bdud thams cad las nges par rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces pa'i gsang sngags chen po gang gi dpung par son cing gnas pa de bdud thams cad las nges par rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever has this great mantra on his arm will be victorious over all demons.

original: aom kro dha ne sam ko sha ne bhe da ne h'um phat/
analyzed: aom kro dha ne sam ko sha ne bhe da ne h'um phat/
translated: Oṃ krodhaṇa saṃkośana bhedana hūṃ phaṭ.

original: chu la mngon par bsngags nas sbyin par bya ste gzer sel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu la mngon par bsngags nas sbyin par bya ste gzer sel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having enchanted water with this, one should give it to drink; it will remove pain.🔽Oṃ santra āsana mohaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom santr'a a'a sa ne mo h'a ya h'um phat zhes pa 'dis spyi gtsug tu bcings na mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: aom santr'a a'a sa ne mo h'a ya h'um phat zhes pa 'dis spyi gtsug tu bcings na mi mthong ngo //
translated: By this, having bound it on the crown of the head, one will not be seen.

original: aom aa tsa le sanytsa le che ge mo'i mu kham k'i la ya h'um phat/🔽myos byed la gzugs brnyan byas nas gro ga la ba blas bris nas de'i khar bcug ste /
analyzed: aom aa tsa le sanytsa le che ge mo'i mu kham k'i la ya h'um phat/ myos byed la gzugs brnyan byas nas gro ga la ba blas bris nas de'i khar bcug ste /
translated: Oṃ acale sañcale such-and-such's mouth I bind hūṃ phaṭ.🔽 Having made an effigy of the enemy, having written it on birch bark with bovine bezoar, one should place it under the tongue.

original: phur phus btab la lam bzhi mdor sba bar bya ste /
analyzed: phur phus btab la lam bzhi mdor sba bar bya ste /
translated: Having struck it with a kīla, one should bury it at a crossroads.

original: phyir rgol ba'i kha la phur bus gdab bo //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba'i kha la phur bus gdab bo //
translated: One should strike the mouth of the enemy with a kīla.

original: aom sarbba m'a ra bhanydza ne che ge mo'i b'a doo k'i la ya h'um phat/
analyzed: aom sarbba m'a ra bhanydza ne che ge mo'i b'a doo k'i la ya h'um phat/
translated: Oṃ sarva māra bhanjana such-and-such's mouth I bind hūṃ phaṭ.

original: slar bzhin du snying gar bcug nas rkang pa dag la phur bus gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: slar bzhin du snying gar bcug nas rkang pa dag la phur bus gdab par bya ste /
translated: Again, having inserted it into the heart, one should drive in the dagger into the feet.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rengs par byed do //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rengs par byed do //
translated: It immobilizes the coming and going.

original: aom bi kram t'a na na s'a ra ba la bhanydza ne dzambha ya dzambha ya /
analyzed: aom bi kram t'a na na s'a ra ba la bhanydza ne dzambha ya dzambha ya /

original: stambha ya stambha ya badzra b'a she na che ge mo see n+yam bandha bandha /
analyzed: stambha ya stambha ya badzra b'a she na che ge mo see n+yam bandha bandha /

analyzed: aom h'um phat kha: sha: h'a h'a h'i h'i phem phem aom tsanda mah'a ro sha na h'um phat/

analyzed: bcug nas sde'i bdag po'i gos la phur bus gdab ste /

analyzed: gzugs brnyan kha 'og tu byas te sba bar bya'o //

original: pha rol gyi sde 'ong ba rengs par byed do //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sde 'ong ba rengs par byed do //

analyzed: aom da ha da ha pa tsa pa tsa ma tha ma tha / dzv'a la dzv'a la /

analyzed: dur khrod kyi ral pa bris nas sngar bzhin du gzugs brnyan du bcug ste sor mo'i tshad kyi rus pa'i phur pas @508b sam; lcags kyi phur pas phur bus btab nas dur khrod du kha 'og tu byas nas sbas na nyi ma bdun gyis 'chi bar byed do
translated: “One should draw a corpse, insert the effigy as before, and nail it with a bone nail the size of a finger or an iron nail. If one buries it in a charnel ground with the head facing downward, it will bring death in seven days.

analyzed: // aom tsanda ma h'a ro sha na che ge mo autstsha ta ya h'um phat/

analyzed: nim pa'i shing bya khva ta'i tshang na gnas pa blangs te /

original: dur khrod kyi mes bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: dur khrod kyi mes bsreg par bya'o //

analyzed: de'i thal ba la brgya rtsa brgyad du mngon par bsngags te /

original: khyim dang gos la gtor te gzhag go /
analyzed: khyim dang gos la gtor te gzhag go /
translated: One should scatter it in the house and on the clothes.

analyzed: rnga mo la zhon pa g-yon par byed pa'i zhags pas bcings nas lho'i phyogs su drangs par yid kyis bsam par bya ste /
translated: Imagining that he is bound by the noose in the left [hand] of the one riding the camel, he is dragged off to the south.

original: skrod par byed do //
analyzed: skrod par byed do //
translated: He is expelled.

original: aom dve she dve she badzre che ge mos bi dve sha ya aom tsanda ma h'a ro sha na h'um phat/
analyzed: aom dve she dve she badzre che ge mos bi dve sha ya aom tsanda ma h'a ro sha na h'um phat/
translated: Oṃ, O you who are angry, angry, and vajra, [make so and so] angry! Oṃ, Caṇḍamahāroṣaṇa, hūṃ phaṭ!

original: 'thab bzhin pa'i glang po dag gi rdul bzung nas bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan byas nas gnyis po la bsnun par bya'o //
analyzed: 'thab bzhin pa'i glang po dag gi rdul bzung nas bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan byas nas gnyis po la bsnun par bya'o //

analyzed: phan tshun sdang bar byad do // aom tsanda ma h'a ro sha na hri: hri: hrem go ra r'u be na tsa ta tsa ta pra tsa ta pra tsa ta / ha na ha na gh'a ta ya gh'a ta y'a kaddhya kaddhya pra sphu ra pra sphu ra /
translated: They will become mutually hostile.

original: pra sph'a ra ya pra sph'a ra ya /
analyzed: pra sph'a ra ya pra sph'a ra ya /
translated: Oṃ, Caṇḍamahāroṣaṇa, hriḥ hriḥ, hreṃ go ra ra u ve na ca ta ca ta pra ca ta pra ca ta, ha na ha na gha ṭa ya gha ṭa ya khad dha ya khad dha ya pra sphu ra pra sphu ra, pra sphā ra ya pra sphā ra ya,

original: k'i la ya k'i la ya /
analyzed: k'i la ya k'i la ya /
translated: kī la ya kī la ya,

original: dzambha ya dzambha ya /
analyzed: dzambha ya dzambha ya /
translated: jaṃbha ya jaṃbha ya,

original: stambha ya stambha ya che ge mo la h'um phat/
analyzed: stambha ya stambha ya che ge mo la h'um phat/

original: gro ga la ta la'i smyu gus rus sbal sor drug par mnyam par bris nas rkang pa bzhi la hrim gi yi ge dang / kha'i dbus su sht'i: yi ge'o //
analyzed: gro ga la ta la'i smyu gus rus sbal sor drug par mnyam par bris nas rkang pa bzhi la hrim gi yi ge dang / kha'i dbus su sht'i: yi ge'o //
translated: Having drawn a tortoise of six fingerbreadths on birch bark with a palm leaf pen, one should write the syllable hrim on the four feet, and in the middle of the mouth the syllable shti.

original: sdang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will become hostile.

original: de nas bris pa'i bsgrub bya de'i rgyab sngags kyi phreng ba gzhan gyis kun tu dkris te mchod na /
analyzed: de nas bris pa'i bsgrub bya de'i rgyab sngags kyi phreng ba gzhan gyis kun tu dkris te mchod na /
translated: Then, having completely wrapped the back of the effigy of the victim with a garland of the mantra, and worshipped it,

analyzed: de nas brtsams te 'dod pa yongs su nyams te rus sbal bzhin du mang pos yog par @509a *//

analyzed: byed do // srad bu dmar pos kun tu dkris nas rkang pa rab tu bsdus nas mi 'degs par byas la /
translated: Having completely wrapped it with a red thread, and having completely contracted the feet, and having made it not lifted,

analyzed: mi li mi li n'a li te h'um phat/

analyzed: bandha bandha / aom tsanda ma h'a ro sha na h'um phat/
translated: Oṃ caṇḍa mahāroṣaṇa hūṃ phaṭ.

original: ro'i rus pa'i phur pa sor bdun pa'i ched la brgya rtsa brgyad du mngon par bsngags nas ba lang gnas su sbas na 'o ma mi 'dzag go //
analyzed: ro'i rus pa'i phur pa sor bdun pa'i ched la brgya rtsa brgyad du mngon par bsngags nas ba lang gnas su sbas na 'o ma mi 'dzag go //
translated: Having enchanted a bone dagger of a corpse one hundred and eight times, if one buries it in the place of a cow, the milk will not flow.

original: aom ba li pattram ba ta ya su ra ba ri ma dzny'a pa ya ti dzv'a la ya dzv'a la ya /
analyzed: aom ba li pattram ba ta ya su ra ba ri ma dzny'a pa ya ti dzv'a la ya dzv'a la ya /
translated: Oṃ bali patraṃ vadāya surāvarī majñāpayati jvālāya jvālāya.

original: aom tsanda ma h'a ro sha na h'um phat/
analyzed: aom tsanda ma h'a ro sha na h'um phat/
translated: Oṃ caṇḍa mahāroṣaṇa hūṃ phaṭ.

original: grog mkhar gyi sa'i gong bu la brgya rtsa brgyad du mngon par bsngags te tshong pa'i khyim du sba bar bya ste /
analyzed: grog mkhar gyi sa'i gong bu la brgya rtsa brgyad du mngon par bsngags te tshong pa'i khyim du sba bar bya ste /
translated: Having enchanted a lump of anthill earth one hundred and eight times, one should bury it in the house of a merchant.

original: zong mi brin no //
analyzed: zong mi brin no //
translated: His goods will not sell.

original: aom hrim hrim tram bram ya ma ma tha ni a'a kaddhya a'a kaddhya ksho bha ya ksho bha ya /
analyzed: aom hrim hrim tram bram ya ma ma tha ni a'a kaddhya a'a kaddhya ksho bha ya ksho bha ya /

original: sarb'a k'a ma pra s'a dha ne h'um h'um phat phat sv'ah'a /
analyzed: sarb'a k'a ma pra s'a dha ne h'um h'um phat phat sv'ah'a /
translated: sarvakāmaprasādhanāya hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: gro ga'i 'dab ma la gur gum dang / yang dag par ldan pas lha phyag gnyis pa lag na zhags pa dang lcags kyu can 'dod pa drag cing 'jigs par byed pa bris la /
analyzed: gro ga'i 'dab ma la gur gum dang / yang dag par ldan pas lha phyag gnyis pa lag na zhags pa dang lcags kyu can 'dod pa drag cing 'jigs par byed pa bris la /
translated: On a birch-bark leaf, with saffron, one should draw a two-armed deity, holding a noose and a goad, fierce and terrifying, saying, Give! Give!

original: glang po che'i chang dang zla mtshan dang me tog gi sngags kyis yi ge rnams spel bar bya'o //
analyzed: glang po che'i chang dang zla mtshan dang me tog gi sngags kyis yi ge rnams spel bar bya'o //
translated: With the mantra of the flower, one should increase the letters with elephant urine, menstrual blood, and flower.

original: aom spyi bor ro //🔽h'um snying gar ro //
analyzed: aom spyi bor ro // h'um snying gar ro //
translated: Om-at the head.🔽 Hum-at the heart.

original: hrim lte bar ro //
analyzed: hrim lte bar ro //
translated: Hriim-at the navel.

original: tam mig tu'o //
analyzed: tam mig tu'o //
translated: Tam-at the eyes.

original: de la sngags kyi phreng bas bskor nas khrag gis kun tu bkang @509b zhing; phye mar byas te skyes pa dang bud med kyi thod par bcu nas mar dang sbrang rtsis bkang ste myos byed kyi sa dang srad bu dmar pos dkris nas mgo bo'i gnas su sba
analyzed: de la sngags kyi phreng bas bskor nas khrag gis kun tu bkang @509b zhing; phye mar byas te skyes pa dang bud med kyi thod par bcu nas mar dang sbrang rtsis bkang ste myos byed kyi sa dang srad bu dmar pos dkris nas mgo bo'i gnas su sba
translated: Having surrounded the garland of mantras, one should fill it with blood, grind it, and place it in a skull of a man or a woman, filled with ghee and honey, wrapped with the earth of a cemetery and a red thread, and bury it in a charnel ground.

original: bar bya'o // rkang pa g-yon pas mnan nas bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: bar bya'o // rkang pa g-yon pas mnan nas bzlas par bya ste /
translated: Having pressed it down with the left foot, one should recite.

original: stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lngas grong 'khrug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lngas grong 'khrug par 'gyur ro //
translated: By twenty-five thousand, there will be a village quarrel.

original: aom a'a kaddhya a'a kaddhya mo ha ya mo ha ya che ge mo me ba ba sh'am bha ba tu sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom a'a kaddhya a'a kaddhya mo ha ya mo ha ya che ge mo me ba ba sh'am bha ba tu sv'ah'a /
translated: Oṃ, summon, summon! Fascinate, fascinate! So-and-so, come, come!

original: lto ba'i srin bu phra mo'i phye ma dang khu ba dang ming med kyi khrag dag gis ba di ka byas nas mngon par bsngags te bza' ba dang btung ba la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: lto ba'i srin bu phra mo'i phye ma dang khu ba dang ming med kyi khrag dag gis ba di ka byas nas mngon par bsngags te bza' ba dang btung ba la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: One should make a paste of the fine dust of the worms in the belly, the juice, and the blood of the penis, and incant it. It should be given to the food and drink.

original: gyen du 'khor ba'i 'dab ma dag dang / bung ba'i gshog pa dag dang / rgyal po gnyis kyi so dag dang / shi ba'i phreng ba rnam par btags pa'i phye ma 'dis rgyal ba'i lus can lus can gyi rjes nas rjes nas rgyug go /
analyzed: gyen du 'khor ba'i 'dab ma dag dang / bung ba'i gshog pa dag dang / rgyal po gnyis kyi so dag dang / shi ba'i phreng ba rnam par btags pa'i phye ma 'dis rgyal ba'i lus can lus can gyi rjes nas rjes nas rgyug go /
translated: The dust of the upward-moving petals, the wings of bees, the teeth of the two kings, and the garland of the dead—with this, the one with a victorious body runs after the embodied one, after the embodied one.

original: aom shve te gri dhri n'i kh'a hi bi shanytsa ru pi n'i kha: kha: aa ti mrittva dv'a re ts'i ra ka b'a b'a sa bant'a be sha: ha: ha: sa: sa: tsanda ma h'a ro sha na se na a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom shve te gri dhri n'i kh'a hi bi shanytsa ru pi n'i kha: kha: aa ti mrittva dv'a re ts'i ra ka b'a b'a sa bant'a be sha: ha: ha: sa: sa: tsanda ma h'a ro sha na se na a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sv'ah'a /
translated: Oṃ, Śvetā, Gṛdhranī, khaṃ! Viśaṃcarūpiṇī, khaṃ! Atimartavāre, carakā, vāpā, vasantā, veśaḥ! Haṃ! Haṃ! Saṃ! Saṃ! Caṇḍa, Mahāroṣaṇa, sena, ā, jñāpayati, svāhā.

original: yang na / aom sam k'a ri ni tsam bam h'am ham h'um h'a /
analyzed: yang na / aom sam k'a ri ni tsam bam h'am ham h'um h'a /
translated: Oṃ saṃkarīni caṃbaṃ haṃ haṃ haṃ hūṃ hāṃ.

original: dug thams cad 'joms par byed do //🔽aom n'a g'a ri b'a ma ne ha ra ha ra phat phat/
analyzed: dug thams cad 'joms par byed do // aom n'a g'a ri b'a ma ne ha ra ha ra phat phat/
translated: It destroys all poisons.🔽Oṃ nāgarī vāmane hara hara phaṭ phaṭ.

original: aom a'a ne k'a ne che ge mo ba sh'am ku ru sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom a'a ne k'a ne che ge mo ba sh'am ku ru sv'ah'a /
translated: Oṃ ānake such-and-such, make him submit svāhā.

original: dri bzang po can gyi me tog dkar po sbyin pa las dbang du byed do //
analyzed: dri bzang po can gyi me tog dkar po sbyin pa las dbang du byed do //
translated: By offering white flowers with a pleasant smell, one brings under one's control.

original: na mo bi t'a g'a ya mee tri siddha lo tsa sv'ah'a /
analyzed: na mo bi t'a g'a ya mee tri siddha lo tsa sv'ah'a /
translated: Namo vitāgāya maitre siddhalocane svāhā.

original: chu la mngon par bsngags nas des mig brkus pa las rab rib 'joms par byed @510a *//
analyzed: chu la mngon par bsngags nas des mig brkus pa las rab rib 'joms par byed @510a *//
translated: Having enchanted water, by sprinkling it in the eyes, it destroys blindness.

original: do; ;aom ban kha kha tsurna kh'a n'a tan pra bha ba ti /🔽a'a dirya ra tha be ge na ba su de ba ba len tsa /
analyzed: do; ;aom ban kha kha tsurna kh'a n'a tan pra bha ba ti / a'a dirya ra tha be ge na ba su de ba ba len tsa /
translated: Oṃ vaṃ kha kha cūrṇakānāṃ prabhavatī.🔽Āditya-ratha-vegena vasudeva-balena ca.

original: ga ru da p'a kshi sa de na bh'u mya gatstsha bi sham sv'ah'a /
analyzed: ga ru da p'a kshi sa de na bh'u mya gatstsha bi sham sv'ah'a /
translated: Garuḍa-pākaśasadena bhūmy-aṃśe viśaṃ svāhā.

original: sbrul dang sdig pa dang / karka ta la sogs pa'i dug 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: sbrul dang sdig pa dang / karka ta la sogs pa'i dug 'joms par byed do //
translated: It destroys the poisons of snakes, scorpions, crabs, and so forth.

original: aom ts'a munde aa dzi te aa pa r'a dzi te aa pa r'a ji te phu phu raksha raksha sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom ts'a munde aa dzi te aa pa r'a dzi te aa pa r'a ji te phu phu raksha raksha sv'ah'a /
translated: Oṃ, Caṇḍamahāroṣaṇa, the invincible, the unconquerable, the unconquerable, the protector, protect, svāhā.

original: bong ba la lan bdun mngon par bsngags nas phyogs bzhir 'phang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bong ba la lan bdun mngon par bsngags nas phyogs bzhir 'phang bar bya'o //
translated: Having enchanted a clod of earth seven times, one should throw it in the four directions.

original: de bzhin du gcig gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gcig gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should place one (clod).

original: aom dzambha n'i stambha n'i mo ha n'i sarba dushta pra sh'a ma ni sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom dzambha n'i stambha n'i mo ha n'i sarba dushta pra sh'a ma ni sv'ah'a /
translated: Oṃ, Jambhani, Stambhani, Mohani, Prashamani of all evildoers, svāhā.

original: chom rkun mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chom rkun mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Thieves will not appear.

original: aom na ma: tsanda kro dh'a ya hu lu hu lu tishtha tishtha bandha bandha mo ha ya mo ha ya ha na ha na h'um phat/
analyzed: aom na ma: tsanda kro dh'a ya hu lu hu lu tishtha tishtha bandha bandha mo ha ya mo ha ya ha na ha na h'um phat/
translated: Oṃ, Namo, to Caṇḍakrodha, Huluhulu, Tiṣṭha tiṣṭha, Bhandha bhandha, Moha moha, Hana hana, hūṃ phaṭ.

original: me tog la sogs pa la yongs su bzlas te byin pa la dbang du byed do //
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa la yongs su bzlas te byin pa la dbang du byed do //
translated: Having enchanted flowers, etc., and given (them), one subjugates.

original: na mo ratna tra y'a ya aom ta: su: bisma re sv'ah'a /
analyzed: na mo ratna tra y'a ya aom ta: su: bisma re sv'ah'a /
translated: Namo ratnatrayāya, Oṃ, taḥ suḥ vishmara svāhā.

original: ke ta ki 'dab ma lus la bcangs na rims thams cad 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: ke ta ki 'dab ma lus la bcangs na rims thams cad 'joms par byed do //
translated: If one wears a ketaki leaf on one's body, it destroys all fevers.

original: zhes pa gshin rje'i gshed dmar po'i rgyud du dpa' bo gcig pa'i sgrub thabs la sogs pa 'khrul 'khor dang / sngags kyi le'u ste bcu dgu pa'o ////
analyzed: zhes pa gshin rje'i gshed dmar po'i rgyud du dpa' bo gcig pa'i sgrub thabs la sogs pa 'khrul 'khor dang / sngags kyi le'u ste bcu dgu pa'o ////
translated: This is the nineteenth chapter, the chapter on the cakras and mantras, from the Tantra of Red Yamari.

original: bcom ldan 'das mas gsol ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mas gsol ba /
translated: The Blessed Lady said:🔽The Blessed One should listen to the spectacle.

original: bcom ldan 'das ltad mo nyan par 'tshal lo; ;sh'a kho ta ka'i rtsa ba dang / ba ru ra'i rtsa ba gcig tu byas nas khyim du gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ltad mo nyan par 'tshal lo; ;sh'a kho ta ka'i rtsa ba dang / ba ru ra'i rtsa ba gcig tu byas nas khyim du gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Having made the root of shakhotaka and the root of varuni into one, it should be placed in the house.

original: rtsod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsod par 'gyur ro //
translated: There will be a dispute.

original: da dhu ra'i me tog gi dbus su gnas pa'i gunda ka dri bzang @510b po'i me tog gi dbus su bcug pa tsam gyis mgo la gzer 'byung ngo //
analyzed: da dhu ra'i me tog gi dbus su gnas pa'i gunda ka dri bzang @510b po'i me tog gi dbus su bcug pa tsam gyis mgo la gzer 'byung ngo //
translated: By merely inserting the gunjika flower, which is located in the middle of the flower of dadhuri, into the middle of a fragrant flower, a headache will occur.

original: rtsab mos nyams par byas pas grol lo //
analyzed: rtsab mos nyams par byas pas grol lo //
translated: By being impaired by the essence, it is released.

original: khyi mo'i mngal gyi mal stan des bdugs te bskor la rma bya'i mjug mas g-yas su bskor bas ri mo 'phrog go /
analyzed: khyi mo'i mngal gyi mal stan des bdugs te bskor la rma bya'i mjug mas g-yas su bskor bas ri mo 'phrog go /
translated: Having fumigated the bed of a bitch's womb with that, and having circled it with a peacock's tail, by circling to the right, the design is stolen.

original: g-yon du bskor ba yis thar ro //
analyzed: g-yon du bskor ba yis thar ro //
translated: By circling to the left, it is liberated.

original: khva ta'i snying khrag gis shing aa mra'i 'dab ma la de'i gzugs brnyan bri ba'i tshul gyis bris pa'i 'khrul 'khor gang gi bshang ba la bzhag pa de khva tas bza' bar byed do //
analyzed: khva ta'i snying khrag gis shing aa mra'i 'dab ma la de'i gzugs brnyan bri ba'i tshul gyis bris pa'i 'khrul 'khor gang gi bshang ba la bzhag pa de khva tas bza' bar byed do //
translated: The excrement of whoever is placed on a magic diagram drawn with the blood of a crow’s heart on a mango leaf in the form of a crow will be eaten by the crow.

original: bha ga'i rnam pas dong byas nas bud med kyi bshang ba dang sdig pa dang / pattri ka dang ldan pa bcug nas byug par bya ste /
analyzed: bha ga'i rnam pas dong byas nas bud med kyi bshang ba dang sdig pa dang / pattri ka dang ldan pa bcug nas byug par bya ste /
translated: Having made a hole with the form of a bhaga, one should insert the excrement of a woman, poison, and pattrika, and anoint it.

original: de'i lam du gnod par byed do //
analyzed: de'i lam du gnod par byed do //
translated: It will cause harm in her path.

original: shing snu ha'i 'o mas bsgos pa'i til gyi til mar bskus pa las mgo skyes dkar por 'gyur ro; ;skra bzhar ba yis thar ro //
analyzed: shing snu ha'i 'o mas bsgos pa'i til gyi til mar bskus pa las mgo skyes dkar por 'gyur ro; ;skra bzhar ba yis thar ro //
translated: Anointed with sesamum oil soaked with the milk of snuhi, the pubic hair will become white.

original: byi la mo'i phru ma dang / mi mo'i phru ma dag gis bdugs pa las zla ba'i ri mo mi mthong bar byed do //
analyzed: byi la mo'i phru ma dang / mi mo'i phru ma dag gis bdugs pa las zla ba'i ri mo mi mthong bar byed do //
translated: Smoked with the dung of a female cat and a human child, one will not see the mark of the moon.

original: sbrang rtsi'i bdugs pas thar ro //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi'i bdugs pas thar ro //
translated: One will be freed by smoking with honey.

original: rnga mo'i thod pa dang / dbyug pa dkar po dang / skud pa la ba blas bskus nas lag pa la bskus nas nyi mar byas na ri mo mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnga mo'i thod pa dang / dbyug pa dkar po dang / skud pa la ba blas bskus nas lag pa la bskus nas nyi mar byas na ri mo mthong ngo //
translated: The tortoise shell, a white stick, and a thread smeared with babble, if smeared on the hand and used as a sun, one sees the lines.

original: lag pa bkrus pa las thar ro //
analyzed: lag pa bkrus pa las thar ro //
translated: By washing the hands, one is freed.

original: bud med kyi phru ma'i bdugs pa las ri mo 'gebs par byed do //
analyzed: bud med kyi phru ma'i bdugs pa las ri mo 'gebs par byed do //
translated: By fumigating with the placenta of a woman, one covers the lines.

original: gu gul gyis ba dugs pa las thar ro //
analyzed: gu gul gyis ba dugs pa las thar ro //
translated: By fumigating with gugul, one is freed. 🔽By using frog fat as eye ointment, one sees a snake in the house.

original: sbal pa'i zhun mar gyis mig sman las khyim du 'brel ba'i sbrul mthong ngo //🔽mar me @511a *//
analyzed: sbal pa'i zhun mar gyis mig sman las khyim du 'brel ba'i sbrul mthong ngo // mar me @511a *//
translated: By using a lamp, one sees a snake.

original: mnal ba'i me la mu zi'i phye ma byin pa las 'bar bar byed do //
analyzed: mnal ba'i me la mu zi'i phye ma byin pa las 'bar bar byed do //
translated: By offering mica powder to the fire of a dying lamp, it blazes.

original: shing sna hi'i rtsa ba dang bu ram zos na gnyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing sna hi'i rtsa ba dang bu ram zos na gnyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: By eating the root and molasses of the tree called sna hi, one becomes sleepless.

original: k'a ma tsi'i rtsa ba gtsug tor du bcing bar bya ste /🔽gnyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: k'a ma tsi'i rtsa ba gtsug tor du bcing bar bya ste /🔽gnyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: By binding the root of kamaci to the ushnisha, one becomes sleepless. 🔽By binding the root of kamaci to the ushnisha, one becomes sleepless.

original: klu 'dul bar byed pa drom ni'i me tog gi rtsa ba dang / yung ba dang / 'bras thug po che btags nas dril phyis byas pa las tshu yongs su zad pa las rgyal la //
analyzed: klu 'dul bar byed pa drom ni'i me tog gi rtsa ba dang / yung ba dang / 'bras thug po che btags nas dril phyis byas pa las tshu yongs su zad pa las rgyal la //
translated: To subdue a nāga, one should grind the root of a dromni flower, turmeric, and black sesame seeds, and apply it.

original: shing shal ma la'i rtsa ba la mtshal dang ldan pa zos pa las me tog ltung bar bya'o //
analyzed: shing shal ma la'i rtsa ba la mtshal dang ldan pa zos pa las me tog ltung bar bya'o //
translated: By eating the root of a śalmali tree together with madder, the menstrual flow will cease.

original: kam gushtha dang / ma dir ya sbyin par bya ba'am /
analyzed: kam gushtha dang / ma dir ya sbyin par bya ba'am /
translated: One should give kamalā and madana.

original: yang tambu la yis rdul dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang tambu la yis rdul dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or one will become free from impurities with tambula.

original: shing snu ha'i lo ma dang man ta'i sa bon dang / gu na'i phye mas bu ram dang lhan cig zos pa las khrag ltung ngo //
analyzed: shing snu ha'i lo ma dang man ta'i sa bon dang / gu na'i phye mas bu ram dang lhan cig zos pa las khrag ltung ngo //
translated: By eating the leaves of a snuhī tree, the seeds of a mandūka, and the powder of guñjā together with molasses, the menstrual flow will cease.

original: tshu tshun dha ra'i phye mas rta'i sna la bskus na zas mi byed do //
analyzed: tshu tshun dha ra'i phye mas rta'i sna la bskus na zas mi byed do //
translated: By smearing the powder of tshun dhara on a horse's nose, it will not eat.

original: tsandan gyis bkrus pa las thar ro //🔽shing ke ta'i rtsa ba mgo la bcing bar bya /🔽shing 'bra go'i rtsa ba lag pa la /
analyzed: tsandan gyis bkrus pa las thar ro // shing ke ta'i rtsa ba mgo la bcing bar bya / shing 'bra go'i rtsa ba lag pa la /
translated: By washing with sandalwood, one will be released.🔽One should tie the root of a keta tree on one's head.🔽The root of a bṛhatī tree on one's hand.

original: shing ta la'i rtsa ba khu ru ma rgyal la gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: shing ta la'i rtsa ba khu ru ma rgyal la gdon par bya'o //
translated: The root of a tāla tree on one's knee.

original: byang phyogs su bltas te gcer bu skra grol bar gyur nas gsum po rnams cung zad btags nas btung bar bya ste /
analyzed: byang phyogs su bltas te gcer bu skra grol bar gyur nas gsum po rnams cung zad btags nas btung bar bya ste /
translated: Looking to the north, naked, with loose hair, one should crush the three [substances] a little and drink them.

original: mtshon chas 'joms par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshon chas 'joms par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not be destroyed by weapons.

original: sho na ka'i sa bon dang / p'u ra ka p'a du ka gnyis po sha pa'i pags pa'i khud du de mnyes te lce'i mthil du bzhag pa latta pa'i 'bras bu zos @511b ba las /
analyzed: sho na ka'i sa bon dang / p'u ra ka p'a du ka gnyis po sha pa'i pags pa'i khud du de mnyes te lce'i mthil du bzhag pa latta pa'i 'bras bu zos @511b ba las /
translated: The seed of śoṇaka and the two [substances] pūraka and pāduka, having ground them in the hollow of a śāpa leaf, one should place them on the surface of the tongue and eat the fruit of the lattā plant.🔽One will not be burned.🔽Thus ends the twentieth chapter on the common medicine in the Tantra of Red Yamāri.

original: sreg par mi byed do zhes gshin rje'i gshed dmar po'i rgyud du thun mong gi sman gyi le'u sti nyi shu pa'o ////
analyzed: sreg par mi byed do zhes gshin rje'i gshed dmar po'i rgyud du thun mong gi sman gyi le'u sti nyi shu pa'o ////
translated: Chapter Twenty-One: The Procedure of the Secret Signs

original: kya bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: kya bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the Vajra Lord of Wrath: Vajra Lord of Wrath, listen!

original: ji ltar dus byed pa dang; sems can byed par nges pa de rnams kyi rgyu mtshan bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan du gsol /
analyzed: ji ltar dus byed pa dang; sems can byed par nges pa de rnams kyi rgyu mtshan bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan du gsol /
translated: How is it that those who are certain to die and to kill sentient beings, their signs, O Blessed One, please teach!

original: rkang pa dang rkan la phug nas mig tu zug pa las zla ba gsum gyis grub bo //
analyzed: rkang pa dang rkan la phug nas mig tu zug pa las zla ba gsum gyis grub bo //
translated: Having pierced the foot and palate, [the poison] enters the eye. In three months it is accomplished.

original: rna bar phug pas zla ba bzhis so //
analyzed: rna bar phug pas zla ba bzhis so //
translated: Having pierced the ear, [the poison] enters in four months.

original: mdzod spur zug pa las nyi ma gcig gis so //
analyzed: mdzod spur zug pa las nyi ma gcig gis so //
translated: Having pierced the tuft, [the poison] enters in one day.

original: rkang pa dang rkan la phug nas lte bar zug pa las zla ba gsum gyis 'chi'o //
analyzed: rkang pa dang rkan la phug nas lte bar zug pa las zla ba gsum gyis 'chi'o //
translated: If it enters the foot and palate and pierces the navel, [the patient] will die in three months.

original: rkang pa dang rkan la phug nas sna la zug pa las zla ba gsum gyis so //
analyzed: rkang pa dang rkan la phug nas sna la zug pa las zla ba gsum gyis so //
translated: If it enters the foot and palate and pierces the nose, [the patient] will die in three months.

original: bshang ba rab tu 'dzag pa'i dus mtshungs par sbrid pa byung na lo gcig gis so //
analyzed: bshang ba rab tu 'dzag pa'i dus mtshungs par sbrid pa byung na lo gcig gis so //
translated: If the time of diarrhea is accompanied by sneezing, [the patient] will die in one year.

original: shin tu dga' ba'i rab tu gal te sbrid pa byung ba dang mtshungs par mthe chung thams cad du zug pa las zla bas so //
analyzed: shin tu dga' ba'i rab tu gal te sbrid pa byung ba dang mtshungs par mthe chung thams cad du zug pa las zla bas so //
translated: If there is sneezing accompanied by great joy, if it pierces all the little fingers, [the patient] will die in one month.

original: snying dang mgrin par zug pa las phyogs gsum gyis so //
analyzed: snying dang mgrin par zug pa las phyogs gsum gyis so //
translated: If it pierces the heart and throat, [the patient] will die in three fortnights.

original: mtshungs par rkan la gsum zug pa las nyi ma gsum gyis so //
analyzed: mtshungs par rkan la gsum zug pa las nyi ma gsum gyis so //
translated: If it pierces the palate in the same way, [the patient] will die in three days.

original: rkang pa'i mthe bong nas brtsams nas lte ba'i mthar thug par zug pa las zla ba drug gis so //
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthe bong nas brtsams nas lte ba'i mthar thug par zug pa las zla ba drug gis so //
translated: If it pierces from the big toe up to the navel, [the patient] will die in six months.

original: sna'i rtse mor zla bas de der gyur na mtshan mo bdun gyis 'chi pa'i dus su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sna'i rtse mor zla bas de der gyur na mtshan mo bdun gyis 'chi pa'i dus su 'gyur ro //
translated: If it pierces the tip of the nose, [the patient] will die in seven nights.

original: rna ba dag gi dril bu'i sgra las zla ba gsum gyis so //
analyzed: rna ba dag gi dril bu'i sgra las zla ba gsum gyis so //
translated: If there is the sound of a bell in the ears, [the patient] will die in three months.

original: rna ba gnyis dang smin ma'i dbus dang klad pa'i rtse mo rnams su so so so sor zug @512a *//
analyzed: rna ba gnyis dang smin ma'i dbus dang klad pa'i rtse mo rnams su so so so sor zug @512a *//
translated: The two ears, the middle of the eyebrows, and the top of the head are pierced one by one.

original: pa las nyi ma gcig gis so //
analyzed: pa las nyi ma gcig gis so //
translated: [The piercing] is done in one day.

original: sen mo la dmar pa'i mchog tu mthong ba las zla ba drug gis so //
analyzed: sen mo la dmar pa'i mchog tu mthong ba las zla ba drug gis so //
translated: The best [piercing] is the red of the nails, [done] in six months.

original: so bskams pa las zla ba drug gis so //
analyzed: so bskams pa las zla ba drug gis so //
translated: The drying up of the teeth [is done] in six months.
